However as we were on holidays we decided to share the baclava and a chocolate dome for dessert. 

Both were good but the chocolate done was spectacular.

Overall the flavors were excellent, service was typically good and overall this was a very enjoyable meal and something we are happy to recommend.
author: George W.

description:
Ole Ole, a neighourhood gem. A mediterranean cusine with some excellent twist. 

Adana Kabab is the one we gravitate to during dinner but they have a far more broad menu for b'fast and lunch i found out when I took my friend for a quick bite and drink before the 49ers game.

For the romantics in you they have live music - flamingo and gypsy guitar. When no live music they play a variety of spanish music on Pandora...

MAJOR drawback was the recent redo to the bar which saw my choice of draft beer go down from 8 to 3 -- those that the wholeseller gives a bar a better break on. Had to switch to bottle brews :(

Wine list could n should be broadened in my opinion.

Overall a fun date nite every time!
author: Madhusudhan R.

description:
Came here with my friends with a Groupon on my birthday, and I was definitely impressed.  Lots of warm colors in the restaurant; it was very inviting.  

We ordered three appetizers: butter lettuce with grill prawn, a tuna tartar, and a Mediterranean plate with bread/hummus/baba ghanoush.  The appetizers were just average, holding us over until the entrees came out.

When the food arrived, I was so impressed.  The seafood risotto was my favorite; rice was cooked al dente  with beautifully seared scallops and shrimp.  My mouth is still watering.  

Our second dish was a fillet mignon.  Trimmed and cooked a perfect medium rare.  All in all a wonderful dish.

Lastly, we had a duck dish.  This was by far the most disappointing of the three entrees.  The duck tasted overcooked.  It was dry, chewy, tough, and not very enjoyable.  It was seasoned well, but was about all that was good about the duck.  

The chef came out to see how we liked the food, after hearing my disappointment about the duck, he apologized, and grabbed a menu.  He asked us to choose another entree on the house.  We ended up choosing his special: the grilled lamb chops.  The lamb was cooked medium, exactly as ordered.  Seasoned perfectly, and didn't have that gamey taste.  

We were told that the menu changes often.  Customer satisfaction is also really a top priority here.  Will definitely come back to try the new menus.
author: Edward N.

description:
Decided to check this place out after several enthusiastic recommendations from friends. Big disappointment.

The bf and I were delighted to have seating during Mothers' Day Sunday and took the small table outside. Apparently, if you're sitting outside, you'll be ignored.

We did not have our waters nor coffee refilled until we were ready to leave. In fact, we spent way too much time looking longingly inside the window in an attempt to get the servers' attention.

The service was so lacking that our experience inspired the boyfriend's very first Yelp review! (http://www.yelp.com/biz/dunya-san-francisco?hrid=6ufhC7sc2WPDJEEV55u-6w)
author: Furai X.

description: This place is consistently delicious.  Their salmon fillet is one of my favorites. Also love the stuffed falafel salad. The staff is also attentive and the service is great.
author: Roza Z.

description: Might be worth giving it another try, but the food was only okay when I came for brunch.  We showed up around 9:30 am and it was still pretty empty.   The corner booth seats by the outside windows were reserved for 3-person parties.  I ordered a smoked salmon omelette (honestly a bit dry) with extra avocado (great call) and potato wedges (pretty good).   My friend ordered the lamb scramble and seemed to enjoy that.  We didn't partake of the bottomless mimosas ($12) but they sounded great!  Instead I got coffee, and the server was great about making sure it was refilled regularly.   Overall, food was okay, service was good and the decor is nice.   I like the wall of bottles in the back.
author: Vivian W.

description: Went for Saturday brunch. They handled larger group well. $13 bottomless mimosas was a great deal and the French toast and salmon Benedict were both tasty.
author: Eric O.

description:
Overpriced food that is decent at best. Came here and didn't order anything too crazy and ended up spending close to $100 dollars. 

You're better off getting mediterranean food at Le Med in Pac Heights.
author: Michelle A.

description:
I stumbled into this place completely at random...  Walking from my place on Van Ness and Post to the pier 39 to check out the Aquarium by the bay when hunger struck!  Happened to notice a sign saying something about bottomless mimosas!  I liked the sound of that so in we go!

The corned beef hash was yummy with the poached egg on top but I must say the bottomless mimosas at $12 definitely sealed the deal!!  I WILL be back!!  The fact that it is only about 3 blocks from home doesn't hurt either.
author: Antoine V.

description:
I had great hopes for this spot based upon the high star count, but alas, I found myself quite disappointed. 

Let's start with the positives:
- Outdoor seating
- Cool lanterns on the outside
- Cute puppy was near my table (puppy proximity may vary)

Negatives:
- Eggs Benedict was overcooked. Not runny at all. Basically a hard boiled egg on an English muffin.
- Service was pretty bad. Didn't get refills on water or coffee until we got the check. Basically forgotten about by our server.
-Coffee was not fresh 

Overall this was a 2.5 star experience.
author: Alex D.

description:
My gf got a Groupon for Dunya and we decided to check it out the day before my birthday. I arrived at 6:30pm and no one was there. My gf arrived around 7pm and we ordered off their happy hour list. Apparently on Wednesdays, its Ladies Night. If you get a glass of wine, you get the same one free! Wow! 

We ordered the Crispy Ahi Tuna Tartare , Florida Prawns And Organic Butter Lettuce, Smoked Salmon And Grits Pancake, and the Pomegranate Sirloin Steak. The prawns in the salad were ginormous! The tuna tartare were wrapped like an egg roll. The smoked salmon pancake was unique and delicious. Unfortunately the sirloin steak was forgettable. Super dry and bland and overcooked. The happy hour deal was a great deal. A glass of wine and appetizer for $10 along with the Ladies night deal with the buy one glass and get one free. A great place for a happy hour spot or dinner w/ a date. I'll definitely come back and take advantage of the deals!
author: Katie Anne N.

description: Place was lit.. Bottomless mimosas... Great food.. Great service.. Never an empty glass.. Shoutout Ahmet.
author: Nate S.

description:
Visiting from England. Went here on an impromptu night out with friends. Good absolutely delicious. I had the falafel salad with chicken and my friends had the eggplant and mixed grill. Finished every last scrap. Pleasant ambience and friendly staff.

Only improvement would be to serve wider selection of drinks as only serves wine and beer. However, having said that the wine and beer very nice.

Thanks
author: Phoebe C.

description:
Solid food, really inattentive service. 

We go for the lamb burger which is really juicy and flavorful. They also do a well priced bottomless mimosa for weekend brunch. 

But the service is consistently poor. While the people are friendly, we always have to get someone's attention to order, refill water, get the check, etc. One time we sat ourselves down since no one was around, and we went unnoticed us for 10 minutes as we tried our hardest to make eye contact with the waiter. My husband had to literally get up and chase after someone to get menus. We reluctantly go back (we really like that burger!) and the experience is always the same unfortunately.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Being from Washington DC, hearing the words "Brunch" make my ears perk up, my heart beat a little faster, and my stomach growl like a small lion. In addition to Seersucker Thursday on Capitol Hill and Georgetown Cupcake lines that stretch two blocks, weekend brunch is a DC tradition that makes any DMVer (DC, Maryland, and Virginian for you Non-Mid Atlantic Folk) excited. So how does the weekend brunch at Dunya stack up? Well let this East Coaster break it down for you.

First and foremost, getting a reservation here is a must. I came here with a large group, and thankfully for the planning of my peers and the helpful staff, we were able to seat a dozen of us between two tables. The brunch menu consists of Mediterranean inspired wraps, sandwiches, and omelettes, as well as some unique twists on favorites such as huevos rancheros and eggs benedict. In addition, there is the ever popular bottomless mimosas which I will get to later in this review.

So how was the food? I ordered for myself the falafel wrap and a cup of coffee. The food came out pretty quickly for how busy the restaurant was. The wrap was one of the better falafel dishes I have had. Crispy, hot, and surprisingly dense, the falafel was very good and was a nice contrast to the tahini sesame sauce and cool veggies. The size of the wrap was also more than hearty enough for my brunch needs. As a side, my dish came with a small side salad with a simple, slightly sweet vinaigrette and delicious thick cut french fries seasoned with what I believe was sumac, a slightly tart seasoning popular in Mediterranean and Middle Eastern cuisine. I liked the fries so much in fact that I was tempted to order an additional plate on the side (I resisted). So what about the mimosas? I unfortunately am not the biggest fan of drinking during the day since it makes me sleepy, but everyone at my table who ordered it gave it a thumbs up. One thing I did notice was that since it was served from a batch made pitcher, the colour of the mimosas varied from vibrant orange to pale yellow. Whoever was mixing the drinks didn't really have much consistency with the OJ-Champagne ratio.

The restaurant itself is on the compact side. There are several smaller tables both inside and outside as well as a small bar area. The wood plank walls were very interesting as they were slightly decoratively charred with various food-related words. It was a nice touch. One thing I did notice during my visit was that as the brunch hours passed and the mimosas flowed, the restaurant got increasingly louder without the number of patrons really changing. Keep this in mind if you were hoping for a quieter experience. The staff was a highlight of the restaurant. Despite having a massive group, we were taken care of efficiently, our drinks refilled regularly, and were overall treated very nicely. 

So what does this East Coast brunch snob think of Dunya? Overall I was impressed. The food was good, the was service quick, and the value was also decent. My wrap was only $10 which netted me a nicely filling meal. Brunch it up, my friends!
author: Philip T.

description:
The food was okay but nothing that blows you away.  I had a kofte kebab which was pretty good and I loved their portions because it was a healthy take on Middle Eastern food/portions.

Didn't like the carrots and thought that was such a stupid thing to add to a kofte plate.  Also, the thing they give you that is supposed to be an attempt at bread/pita is so gross.  Tasted like a stale matzo
author: Mia F.

description: Excellent food and service, especially I love their Salmon Provencal and Petaluma Chicken
author: Tumar T.

description:
The hummus platter was really delicious. Not sure what everything was but it is quite tasty. Shared with a group and it was devoured. 

Tried the lamb burger too. Fries are terrific. Meat was medium-well just how I wanted it.  :) Definitely enough food on my plate.
author: F T.

description:
Was craving mediterranean food, and a friend suggested Dunya. Good service, cute atmosphere, and decent food. A solid place.

We split the tzatziki, and I had the kofte kabab. Also tried the adnan kebab. The food was good and solid, not amazingly spectacular. The service was good and prompt. My favorite was actually the grilled veggies. 

I liked it, but I'm not sure I'd be going back for food alone. I'd tag along with friends for decent food. To get a higher rating, I'd want more meat and better spicing.
author: Sneha P.

description:
I ate here in March and just got to looking at my receipt... And seems like the waiter charged more tip for himself!! Service was normal, food was actually good as I liked the healthy selection. So this tip thing kind of ruins my good impression of Dunya. 

Be careful!
author: Jing Y.

description:
3.5 stars. The place is small and charming. The food was okay for the most part. Loved the falafel salad and eggplant. I did not enjoy the mixed grill, salmon carpaccio or other appetizers as much. We had a party of 6 and latecomers. I felt a little rushed like they are trying to get us to finish up. Multiple times they tried to take away our plates before we finished. There was an empty seat next to me and I left my purse there. They asked me to remove it. I don't know if they were going to have someone sit with the 6 of us or something. They brought us the check without us asking for it, I don't know what to make of that. 

It's not a bad place for a quick dinner or lunch I'd say. However, I wouldn't come back for the service and attitude I got last night.
author: Julie V.

description:
This is one of my favorite Mediterranean restaurants in the city.  This restaurant and wine bar has a special place in my heart (and stomach).

The food.  The wine.  The servers.  The cooks.  The ambiance... all 5 star worth.

I've been coming to this place since it opened in 2010 and have seen it evolve over time.  Since the beginning the food has always been remarkable.

My favorite dishes are:

- The feta prawns (appetizer)
- The mezze platter (appetizer)
- The adana kebob
- The chicken kebob

And the head cook, Coskun, is one of the friendliest and best cooks I know in the city.  He's always looking to improve the quality of his food, the ambiance of the place and is always great to talk to.

Not only is the food great, but their wine selection is great as well.  I much prefer this place than Amelie for wine.  More locals come to this place I noticed.

I've been coming here for years and will continue to do so.  Great place for date night or to meet up with friends after work if you live in the area.
author: Neema F.

description: Came in for a glass of wine while waiting for our dinner reservation. The wine flight was a great deal- nice pours. The service was good. The perceived manager or owner suggested we try the Muhamara which was tasty. We'd come back for wine and apps!
author: Zoe S.

description: If you like Bottomless mimosas come here!! The servers are amazing and fill you up anytime you are low. The food is bomb as well. New fav place for brunch
author: Katie G.

description: Was there last week for dinner with my wife. I ordered petaluma chicken and my wife ordered Beyti both was tasty and delicious . The server was really friendly.  We will definitly go back .
author: Sergio L.

description:
Go straight for the lamb burger...Seriously... I think I conjured the frikkin' thing.  The first bite sent me on a nostalgic olfactory treasure hunt. "What is in these things?!?"

While I hardly remember what else we ordered I'm giving this place 5 stars for a stellar wine recommendation, a warm eclectic clean comfortable and dimly lit (yay!) interior, a pleasant non-intrusive staff and the cheerfulness my experience there added to an otherwise crappy day.

This is my new neighborhood go-to.

Did I mention the lamb burger? [Drool]
author: Summer S.

description:
It's My second time here, the appetizer and a dessert are amazing! But the main course is 1 star!  
Me and my friends ordered for appetizer Mezze Platter which was great!! Than we have tried the Nicoise Salad that was pretty much bean salad:( and the stuffed Falafel salad that was nice..
The dessert is different story.....just perfect!! Try the baklua and the Malabi!
The place is very nice,modern, service is good although it's take about 20 min to get the food.
author: Maya F.

description: This review for the people who are planing  to go Dunya Restaurant; first of all location is perfect, it is located in one of the best neighbors. When you walk into restaurant you can see the comforting cozy aura and right after that there is no doubt that you will be seated very well. They are serving Mediterranean food also very good wines and beers. The staffs are very nice. Especially the manager Yuksel who has very good knowledge about wine is very nice to every customer. I come here all the time for my favorite burger Lamb Burger. I can say that it is best burger that I ever ate. It's highly recommended. Also they have grilled prawns which has amazing taste. Lastly don't forget to taste beer called Seacoast Pilsener
author: Cihan B.

description: Had the veggie omelette, and my partner had the pastrami omelette.  Maybe we will come back and try dinner because breakfast is not their forte!!!  The omelette's were so bland, I'm in disbelief!  I'm disappointed for sure. Thank god I ordered an IPA. It has way more flavor!
author: Rachel W.

description:
Went there for lunch, had Greek salad and chicken And beef kabob!
It was delicious meal!
author: Katie E.

description:
I have been wanting to write a review for ages.
This is a local spot close to my home so I go here often.
I want to give them 5 stars but in fairness to over all experiencesccan't.
There food is so good.I enjoy there soups , brunch on weekend is amazing , cheese platers and lamb burgers. All Fab.
Owner is a lovely man.
What I've been torn always is the constant change in wait staff or kack there of.
I'm one who hates asking for water , another glass of wine or sitting alone and waiting twenty minutes for my check. Very annoying and ridiculously unexceptable when a place is slow.
The ambiance is beautiful and there is bar sitting and table seating. Great lighting and nice music.
If they had better wait staff I would give 10stars.
author: Connie B.

description: loved the vibe and great menu lots to choose from! the food was delicious and great quantity
author: Arupa A.

description:
Aside from trouble with parking,  I really like this place.

It's small, dim lit quaint place.  Perfect for a date!

Menu isn't so large so I like that I can narrow down my options.

The calamari off the appetizers list was really good with the tomato sauce and the naan was warm!  Just the way I like it!

I ordered the salmon and I thought it was delicious!  Dinner was at about 8p and I wanted something light.  It came with rice, vegetables and just absolutely perfect for someone whose trying to not eat heavy after 7p.

Service was great!  

I wish though that there wasn't just one coed bathroom.... 

I would come back for sure!
author: Thuy H.

description:
I've always brunched at Dunya and had really positive experiences each time - solid brunch food, great friendly service, and even better bottomless mimosas. I actually celebrated my birthday here and they were more than willing to accommodate our large group and everyone had an awesome time.

I tried it out for dinner about a week ago, expecting a decent meal, but nothing that blew me away (because when do you get lucky enough for a good brunch AND dinner spot???) and was TOTALLY impressed with my meal. The salmon was SO good (the lentil lemon garlic sauce on top was a perfect compliment) and didn't leave me feeling heavy or gross after my meal. The calamari appetizer was a good portion and also came with some pita, which is great and a good deal.

All in all, REALLY enjoy the service, food, ambiance and extensive wine list with varied prices (we're talking PAGES) at Dunya. Five stars!!
author: Rebecca C.

description: The potatoes are really good, omelettes are well priced, coffee is from a great place that is right next door, only complaint is the service took quite a while, like 20 min before they took our order.
author: John L.

description:
One of my favorite stops on the San Francisco vacation!  

The atmosphere is intimate and festive.  Very small space, but able to accommodate patrons without feeling like you are stuffed in a sardine can.  

If you can't find your favorite Greek/Mediterranean fare on this menu, you maybe shouldn't be looking for it.  And the wine list is just as extensive to accompany the dinner entrees.  There are also plenty of veggie options!  

I didn't go very traditional, but was told that the lamb burger was not to be passed up...you don't have to ask me twice to try a burger!  And I am glad I did!  It was HUGE!  And the cibatta bread was grilled!
author: Claire G.

description: Terrible service. Food was mediocre. My boyfriend and I ordered the stuffed falafel salad with shrimp, lamb shish kabob, and dolma. Brought my drink about 15 mins later because he forgot about it. Seemed like they didn't have enough people helping since it took about 20 so mins to get our bill. I even tried to stop a waitress and ask if she can get our bill but was ignored. She came back around 20 mins later to ask if we had wanted anything since we called her. It made us really uncomfortable. Everyone just seemed rushed. It wasn't an enjoyable service.
author: Thuy P.

description: Food was ok. We tried the chicken and beef skewers. They were under seasoned for our taste. We sent back the fries because they weren't cooked all the way through and they begrudgingly made them again...the exact same way. Server was friendly and the atmosphere was nice, it was a cute place.
author: Hana H.

description: Overpriced for average Mediterranean food. Still pretty great atmosphere so a nice place to meet friends on Polk before going out. A little small in size so sometimes hard to get a table.
author: Carly K.

description: Don't go there, the service is horrible!  We walked in and the place was empty but for one couple, the waiter wanted to seat us right next to them and refused to seat us anywhere else in the whole empty restaurant because a group of more than two might come later.  He sat us at the bar but then proceeded to ignore us and give us dirty looks. So we just left and we are not going back.
author: Francisco G.

description: Mediocre food, garbage service.  To their credit I had a to go order so they probably already suspected a tip wasn't coming, doesn't mean the guy had to be a douche though. No reason to ever return hope this place becomes another SF restaurant to bite the dust, hopefully something with better service will replace it. Until then fuck this place.
author: Johnny M.

description: Great food! Coming from a Mediterranean heritage its not easy to impress. love this place
author: Sophia P.

description:
If you go with your friends or with a date its great place. Very cozy, the employees are attentive and warm. Their wine is good too. 
Id would recommend this place.
author: Bakulia K.

description:
Big mistake coming here when I'm on a fast from alcohol.  The wine was so tempting and glasses were overflowing -  perfect to go with the variety of appetizer platters on the menu.  Though I didn't get the full experience of this restaurant, my dinner was very, very good.

My bf got the Lamb Kebab and I got the Beyti (ground lamb and beef in wraps).  I've posted a pic as well.  The Beyti was delicious and I love the generous serving of yogurt that went with it.  We also ordered the Falafel appetizer, which I didn't like as the Falafel were very dry.

I enjoyed looking at everyone else's plates which were beautifully arranged.  Fun dinner date atmosphere, though it gets pretty loud.
author: Erica D.

description:
How bad can a restaurant experience get?
Let me tell you...

Called and made a reservation for 9:00pm.  Got there at exactly 9.  They told us the table wasn't ready and that we were welcome to sit at the bar and have some wine.  Sure, why not, we were still waiting on a couple of friends.

Poor selection of wine.  Absolutely nothing special. 

As we were sitting at the bar, the bartender goes:
Bartender: here are the menus.
Us: No thanks, we're just waiting for a table.
Bartender: I don't think you're gonna get a table tonight.  We're busy.

Uuhh what?

The hostess was running back and forth apologizing to us.  Okay I get it, but after a certain point your apologies don't really matter anymore.

We waited 45 minutes for the table.  We were starving.  The staff was so tense and it ruined the whole ambiance.

It was so loud!  There was music, and then there were people talking.  Then they turned the music up, then the people started talking even louder!  It got to the point where we just gave up talking to each other at all.  Awkward.

The food was below average.

Anyway, just a bad experience.  I will not be back for sure, and do not recommend coming here because even a reservation wouldn't be your ticket to a table.
author: Dasha B.

description: Great atmosphere. Sit at the bar, order some appetizers followed by Salmon Provencal. One of the best salmon dishes ive had.
author: Dan A.

description:
I loved the atmosphere, vibe, and food.  I'll definitely be back!  

Everything was delicious!
author: Mara M.

description: I love this place. LOVE. Been coming here for years and shame on me for not reviewing sooner. Really good food. Lovely and reasonably priced wine list. Great happy hour. And everyone on staff is cool. Warm, welcoming, friendly, everything you want. Love love love you guys. So glad to have you on Polk St.
author: Gina L.

description:
I had high hopes coming into this romantical Mediterranean restaurant on Polk. It has a GREAT location though... right next to Bob's donuts! and not too far away from bars galore. 

Ambiance - you win me over here. Cute, dimly lit, gypsy chic style restaurant. Standard SMALL SF style (you can call for a reservation though).  The kind of place you go to split a bottle of wine with friends or date while chatting the night away.  Service was OK, nothing spectacular. 

Food: maybe I should have just eaten a dozen of Bob's donuts. We got hummus ($6) and pita bread. It was plain. I got chicken shish kebab and it was plain ($12). It came with rice and veggies Just tasted like someone threw chicken on a grill without any seasonings. Got a bottle of sparkling rose wine ($30+)  and it was warm ish to begin with. The waiter made us wait while the wine chilled in the bucket of ice. The table was so small that our dishes + wine bucket + wine glasses didn't really fit. We were pretty cramped in there.

Overall - wouldn't really go out of my way to come here again. There's much left to explore in the city and I felt this place wasn't worth a second look. It was sort of mediocre, but wasn't TOO ridiculously expensive, so I couldn't bring it down yet another star for food quality to cost ratio.
author: Christine B.

description:
Welcome to Turkish Brunch!

In a party of three, we were unable to get seated right away, but the bar was open, and they had no problem doing a full meal service there. The bartender was friendly, and even did the math for us on bottomless mimosas "I don't want to judge, but... this is a better deal". And because I suck at math, I pulled out the trusty cell phone, and he was right: as long as they wanted at least three mimosas (and both of my companions had about 4 or 5), it was a VERY good deal -- ended up costing about $2 a mimosa... for West Bay? That's like robbery!

So on to the meal -- it was a little slow coming, but they were super-packed, and the waiter was dutiful at keeping our beverages stocked.

I had a simple corned beef hash, which was a little chunky for my tastes, but the big problem was that my two "poached eggs" were quite literally hard-boiled by the time they got to me, which is why this is not a 5-star rating. Why it IS a 4-star rating is that when I told the server, he not only apologized and sent it back, but he apologized at least 3 other times I could count. Also, the second time around, the eggs were perfectly poached with runny yellows.

Everyone cleaned their plates, everyone was slightly drunk, and none of us had anything negative to say about the noise, decor, service, or price. For what you get? This place is an amazing bargain. 

Get in before they get hip and jack their prices.
author: Amy P.

description: We ordered the lamb meatball appetizer, red lentil soup, and mixed gill platter to split. The lamb meatballs were amazing, but there were only three to share. The red lentil soup was okay, but that's only because I was recently eating it in Turkey. The chicken and lamb kebabs were great! The kofte and Adana kebabs were good too, just not as flavorful and moist as I am used to. The service was very friendly. Nonetheless, I always need a go-to Turkish place, and this will be it in Nob Hill!
author: Kelsey S.

description:
On President's day, wife and I wanted to go Swan Oyter Depot and cash in our Groupon at Bob's Donuts. 

Swan decided to get all patriotic and close down for the day. 

Had to use bathroom...STAT!

Dunya guy was nice enough to let me use the facilities.

There was the most glorious smell from the kitchen.

Wife and I decided to have lunch because of the waiter's kindness and the lure of kitchen's perfumery.

I must have some good karma or need to stumble into more restaurants looking for a loo. 

We ordered the Mezze Platter...a sampler of all the appetizers, a lentil soup, and a Greek salad.

That Mezze Platter was quixotic in the best way...a tour of falafel, dolmas, muhammara, eggplant puree, hummus, and tzatziki. All this came with a million triangles of pita bread...or at least enough to make you feel like you don't have to ask for more.

A lunch of shared entrees and appetizers=35 for two.

This place will dunya good!
author: Michael M.

description: WEll! That was unexpected! Seriously good eats here and "Server extraordinaire; YUKSEL", was more than accommodating to our gluten-free needs. The music is as fresh as the ingredients. Everything was delicious to the point of almost licking the plate!
author: Colleen S.

description: The best Tszaiki I've ever had! I always get the falafel salad, but ask for no dressing. It is always a bit over-dressed and then there is no point of the avocado that goes on the salad.
author: Sandra G.

description: I've ate here 3 times now and it's been a great experience. I recommend trying the hot sauce with your kebabs. The rice is cooked perfect. TONS of wine to choose from if you enjoy wine.
author: Nathaniel C.

description:
Delicious, delicious, delicious!  We had the lamb meatballs served with warm pita bread.... They were meant to share with my mom, but I found myself telling her... "ummm... you might not like these too much," just so I could have them all to myself!  The combination of spices and the perfect texture were almost too much to handle!  Imagine my dismay when my mom also loved the meatballs.  I should've ordered another plate!

My only criticism is that the Greek salad was a little salty, but other than that, everything was wonderful!  I wanted my mom to have a nice birthday dinner and this place was just that.  The decor is so nice and cozy, colorful art on the walls.  We loved it.
author: Stephanie R.

description: Just happened to walk by and decided Mediterranean it was. Both my husband and I were pleasantly surprised by the quality of food. We had the lentil soup to start; really well spiced and great texture. Then we shared the Mezza Plate and chicken kabobs. Everything was spot on and great portions. We will be back!!
author: Erin M.

description:
Dunya has become one of our regular hangout spots. No fuss, no muss, just a great wine list and always delicious food. Our usual includes hummus, lamb meatballs, Greek salad, a glass of malbec and petite sirah. Other dishes were great too. I remember getting a plate and the lamb was cooked perfectly.

HH may be the best time to visit if you can make it! It runs 7 days a week, and it's $10 for a glass of wine and an appetizer. Where else can you find that??
author: Lois W.

description: Me and my boyfriend came here for the first time for brunch. I ordered Greek salad and he ordered eggs Benedict and late for $26. According to him these are the best eggs Benedict he has tried and the latte was really good. My salad was really good however I think that the portion was a bit too small. In general the portions are small even the eggs Benedict. I guess that is good because you don't get all too full. Also there is bottomless mimosas for $12 with real oranges inside. I personally didn't have it but I will order next time. The place must be really nice at night. The atmosphere is really nice. Will come back.
author: Ibelig V.

description:
Intimate, casual atmosphere, good service, and acceptable but unremarkable Mediterranean food. I went for dinner with a friend on a weeknight, and this place strikes me as a nice location to relax with friends, catch a soccer match at the bar (one ~30" TV with low volume showing Premier League) , or go on a casual date. 

The menu is full of Mediterranean classics. The presentation was appetizing but not too creative, and the flavors were good, but unremarkable. Many dishes seemed slightly tuned to American tastes (cream-based sauces, deep frying, etc). The quality of the ingredients was middling, and the preparation uninspired

The service was friendly and very quick, and they had a few daily specials.

The atmosphere and service were fantastic. The problem here is that they're hedging their bets with the food. If the dishes were more daring, authentic, or flavorful, this place could easily bump its star rating.
author: T V.

description:
This is the night my friend and I were not meant to eat. We came here hungry, even let our waitress know while we were ordering how hungry we were. 

We started with 3 flights, Zin-Cab is a must try!
Lamb meatballs- must try (should've ordered two).
Calamari with artichoke- skip it.
Mezze Platter- great variety and awesome flavors!

Finished our appetizers and then waited for the Mixed Grill... waitress: "it should be coming soon..." 15 minutes later no mixed grill. We asked for the check and to have the entree taken off, at this point it was 10:10pm. The waitresses kindly apologized as well as the chef. Offered desert for error, tried the hazelnut desert (don't waste your money). And it took another 15 minutes to get our check. It's a bummer because this place is so close to where I live, probably won't go back.

Fortunately my friend and I are in the hospitality biz and got a good kick out of it.
We spent over $30 each and left hungry.
author: Jenna P.

description: We stopped by during happy hour. The fried cheese appetizer was delicious but the french fries were cold, not fresh, and flavorless. There are some good beer options.
author: H K.

description:
My husband and I were in the mood for brunch a few days ago.  We walked up to Toast, which had a wait.  Dunya had an open table, so we decided to give it a shot.

Bottomless Mimosas ($12): truly bottomless. Always filled.  Good champagne to OJ ratio.

Mediterranean Racheros ($12): I ordered this. Possibly the best breakfast I've had. Pita, hummus, egg, mozz and pomodoro sauce.  So good. It comes with roasted potatoes that my husband ate and said were very good.

Breakfast Special ($12): french toast, 2 eggs, bacon.  Husband orderes this and said the french toast was great. 

Service: impeccable. The mimosas were never empty, same with our water and coffee. Very attentive.
author: Meaghan P.

description: Yummy!!!  Bottomless mimosas are the BEST!!!  Food was delish and such a cute place.  It's also kid friendly
author: Dilenia A.

description: My dad used to tell the Turkish food is the best and he never been wrong being here was a really nice food and wonderful taste 5stat keep this hard working on guys
author: Ahmed M.

description:
Saturday Night Date: October 9, 2010 @ 6:15 PM (Part 2)
Saturday Date Night (Part I): Visit to the Pez Museum and Memorabilia 

I walked in to Dunya with my fiance expecting for the worse.  Of course I did not tell him this since I am the "designated" date night planner in the relationship.  After reviewing so many mixed reviews about Dunya, I was expecting inconsistent food, bad service and dingy wine bar on Polk Street. Since we were already compromised because I purchased a Groupon that was about to expire next month, I thought we had to go.

Little did I know that we  were about to have one of the  nicest casual Saturday Date Night dinners at a wine bar ever.

Dunya is tiny. What it lacked in space, it made up for its tasteful yet simple contemporary/rustic decor.  The burgundy walls were adorned with romantic jazzy artworks. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vvubENH1s-YoZ-sjLWtQMg?select=jDJwF74TQUYOxtCvO7B3og http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vvubENH1s-YoZ-sjLWtQMg?select=ie5zbcS3dy6OzVKYeBBw2g

A handsome wood bar stocked with wine bottles was at the far side of the room. Wine vats were used as focal point. A big blackboard lists the "suggested wine list." Across from the bar is a tiny open kitchen. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vvubENH1s-YoZ-sjLWtQMg?select=ie5zbcS3dy6OzVKYeBBw2g

My fiance and I got the best seats in the house, in my humble opinion.  We were seated by the door at the the L-shaped lounge bench which enabled both of us to have a good view of the wine bar.  It was a good place to go people-watching which at the time we were there was a fun side activity. The place was very festive and happening with people enjoying bottles of wine and small plates.

The service was impeccable! Between the server and the bus boy, we felt really taken care of. They were friendly yet relaxed--none of that pretentious "you-are-at the-wine-bar" kind of attitude. My guy's soda was always filled and our water glasses always topped off.

For starters, we had the MEDITERRANEAN PLATE of homemade Hummus, Baba Ganoush, Yogurt and Pita $10. This plate was so delicious! Everything was definitely homemade and tasted fresh! We asked for a second basket of complimentary bread after we finished the warm pita bread triangles to finish off our Mediterranean Plate. The plate pretty much looked like we licked it clean by the time we left this apps alone! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vvubENH1s-YoZ-sjLWtQMg?select=_k7xd9PoatqB1ikQ5IExnQ http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vvubENH1s-YoZ-sjLWtQMg?select=FV7IxAs19WBCQos3FO_jNQ

I had the SEAFOOD RISOTTO $20 made with arborio rice, white wine, veggies, scallops and prawns topped with parmesan. This dish came to me piping hot and so delicious! The risotto could have been creamier but I have no complaints. Just so flavorful and the asparagus tips were still crunchy. The 2 prawns and 2 scallops were tender and fresh. A perfect comfort food! The portion was huge that I only ate half and took the rest home. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vvubENH1s-YoZ-sjLWtQMg?select=ZxrZWYvwG5mKYQUHTbmdUg

Fiance ordered the RACK OF LAMB WITH PARMESAN MASHED POTATOES AND SPINACH $20. Now for someone who is not a lamb person and who does not usually rave about his food, he said, "Very good!" That's saying a lot!  He thought the lamb was a little sweet which I told him was probably the mint jelly. He cleaned those bones and finished the whole thing! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vvubENH1s-YoZ-sjLWtQMg?select=DAoTuZLgU_hNiWDY_dL18g

We ordered a Lemon Pie $6  to go which looked like a casualty of war by the time we got home. It did not look appetizing anymore after it tumbled around in the car but it still tasted good.

The only thing I was not so thrilled with was my wine. I had a glass of German Riesling  $6 which was described as crisp and sweet. To me it was flat with very short finish. I could not complain though because for the price and generous pour, it was a fair sale.

Overall, I am so glad we gave Dunya a chance. We enjoyed every minute of our date night at this teeny wine bar.  And I am already craving that Risotto right now!

Tab: $74.00 including tax and 2 Diet Cokes before tip and  $30  Groupon. 

I hardly dish out 5 stars but this place on the night we were there deserved if not full 5 stars but at least 4.87849759879 stars for the very friendly service, classy yet casual atmosphere and really delicious food!
author: Leah E.

description: To start the bar tender made space for us at the end of the bar when they had a full house! So that was nice. The wine varieties were plentiful, but not so large as to confound things. We got the metso (sp?) platter which had a variety of tastiness on it.  Definitely a place I want to go back to try dinner.
author: Greg F.

description: The place is awesome, really like the ambience and esp the appetizer and wine was amazing, service was ok. Definetly come back again.
author: Hasnain D.

description:
Was really disappointed in my ground beef/lamb wrap. It was somehow impossibly, neigh inedibly dry. I'm not sure how one makes a wrap such as this without some form of yogurt sauce to round it out.  It also took surprisingly long to come out. 

The waiter was quite nice though! also our yogurt appetizer was tasty so a few extra points for that as well.
author: Misha T.

description:
This place is AWESOME. Now that I have said that, let me elaborate in short, this place is awesome! 
The food is tasty, healthy and reasonably priced, and i can actually eat it everyday. the staff is great, they are courteous, knowledgeable  and attentive. At times they may get busy, which is only a testament to the the quality of experience that brings back repeat patrons. visit this place for an awesome Turkish experience.
author: Kamran R.

description:
I was really excited to try this place after reading many good reviews (and I love mediterranean food). My friends and I shared a bottle of the sparkling rose which was good and the hummus. The hummus had a good creamy texture but the flavor was pretty bland. I think I've made more flavorful hummus than this (or at least bought better hummus from the store). I ordered the grilled eggplant entree which came with yogurt, tomato sauce and some rice. When ordering it, I did not expect half of an eggplant to come out (sliced lengthwise). I expected cut eggplant that was grilled and mixed with other vegetables but nope, just a full on eggplant that was slightly grilled. The yogurt and tomato sauce didn't blend well together. The only good thing about my meal was the rice. My friend ordered a chicken kebab but it wasn't cooked all the way so she had to return it and they cooked it a little better the second time around. My other friends ordered a mixture of the lamb/beef kebabs and they liked their entrees.

Overall, the food wasn't that great despite the hype.
author: Krishna S.

description:
This place was ridiculous. I arrived slightly late for my 11.30 reservation, they take another 5 mins to find my reservation and I'm like, there are clearly empty seats for 4, why can't you just give me a table? 

Food takes about half an hour to come, and while waiting we decide to order for our friend who's late. All the food arrives at the same time. 

Portion size was very disappointing, food did NOT look appetizing in the least and unfortunately didn't taste very good either.  French toast looked measly with 4 slices of bread of some sort, not very eggy at all, though fried crisp on the outside. 

Sea scallop risotto came with 3 scallops which were slightly on the salty side. Risotto was very cheesy and had peppers and onions in it, not bad. 

My friend was disappointed w the beef hash. Actually, the eggs were particularly un-noteworthy. 

Frittata was also just ok. Service was also not very gd. 

This place was pretty disappointing, came here because of a groupon but will not be returning
author: Clarissa L.

description:
Great scene, great wine, great food.

This was our first time at Dunya, we were trying to grab dinner somewhere on Polk Street before meeting friends for a night out.  The restaurant was packed at around 8:30pm when we arrived, however, they were able to accommodate us with 2 seats at the bar (we actually prefer sitting at the bar at restaurants, so this worked out perfectly).

The bar area has a wine-bar feel and you can order from the full menu.  We ordered a nice bottle of red wine and started with the Mezza Platter--which is big!  They don't skimp on this appetizer platter, and it was priced reasonably.

For dinner, I had the lamb shish kebab, and my boyfriend had the chicken petaluma.  Both were large portions with sides or rice and vegetables.  For dessert we had the baklava, which is made with pistachio's instead of walnuts, delicious.

The people who work there were very attentive and social with customers, making it a very welcoming and fun experience.

I cannot wait to go back for all-you-can-drink mimosa brunch!
author: Nic S.

description: Really great service and reasonable price ... We had a Polk omlet and apple sausage which is really YUM !!! They serve bottomless mimosa no time limit ... We will be back soon ...
author: Matt C.

description:
This is my husbands and my go to spot and favorite restaurant. The staff is wonderful. The wine pours are generous and the food is incredible. I get the eggplant and my husband gets the chicken kabobs - truly incredible. The hummus here is the best I have ever had.

You can usually get in without  a reservation although I've had a few times of not getting in. Worth giving them a try.
author: Kelsey C.

description:
Any time I drive around this place I have to stop and eat something.

I love this place it's remind me of my culture type of food and what I like the most is the tasty food that they have.

Food and Desert is one of the best in all bay area.

Thumps up.
author: Omran I.

description: Fried falafel yum, Prawn Kabob entree, delish. Dressings on the salad were very good as well.
author: LJ E.

description:
I can't believe that I have passed by this restaurant for so many years and never came here.  Finally, my friend took me here and I love it!  

Parking can be tough around this area.  We made a reservation at 8pm and luckily we found a street parking right the way.

The atmosphere was great here...cozy and romantic with dim lights.  The service was very good.  Very friendly, helpful and nice.  The waiter also gave us good recommendation on wines.  

We ordered: 

Smoked Salmon Carpaccio - It was pretty good.  The salmon was flavorful.

Lentil Soup - Very rich, creamy and full of flavors

Mixed Grill (Chicken, Lamb and Steak) - Everything was so good.  The chicken was tender and juicy.  

Overall, I had a good dinning experience.  I will definitely go back!
author: Liza T.

description: Came here on a brunch date and loved it! I had the lamb scramble and my date chose to get the huevos rancheros. Both were fantastic and it took them no time to have it made and served to us. The mimosas were delicious as well and didn't have too much OJ in them which was nice. Would definitely come again and try their lunch/dinner menu.
author: Elise B.

description: Great atmosphere and food. Servers were on point and attentive even as they filled up. Have only eaten here once but will definitely come back. The lamb burger was well prepared and the lambs flavor could come through since it was not loaded with too much stuff. The rice was light but with a perfect nutty flavor. Good spot if you want good food without spending too much money or time.
author: Greg M.

description: I love this place!! The staff is very very friendly! I had both dinner and breakfast here and they were both very delicious! Food is really good here and they bring lots of it!! Their desserts baklava and kunefe are also a piece of heaven! Definitely recommend this place!
author: Burcu Ö.

description:
"Life is too short to drink bad wine"...

This is the quote they wrote on their chalkboard outside. I laugh at this because one of the wines I had was only a slight step up from Two Buck Chuck. If you order the wine flight I'd skip the 2009 Terranoble. I googled it and found out you can buy a whole bottle of that crap for only $5.34. Haha. 

People either love this place of hate it...looks like I'm the first 3 star review.  Compared to other Polk Street wine bars it is pretty mediocre...happy hour goes until 7 and you can get a flight of wine for $10 which is three 3 ounce pours from a choice of about 8 wines.  There is also an option to get the appetizer wine pairing for $10. My friend got a glass of Chardonnay and Goat Cheese Mango Salad which was good.
author: Debbie C.

description:
The recently-opened little Mediterranean restaurant at the corner of Polk St and Sacramento was charming and cozy, save for the trick door that refused to shut properly on that cool and breezy Saturday evening.

We started out with the house made iced tea which was pretty good. I, as usual, attacked with gobs of sugar before I made contact.

We ordered the 'stuffed olives with lamb meatballs' and the 'crispy ahi tuna tartare'. 

I loved the meatballs, and the black (Kalamati?) olives embedded in the centre certainly served to enhance the flavor. The sauce, which I was told was a "romesco sauce," was smokey and flavorful. I felt it kicked up the dish a few notches. 

The Crispy Tuna Tartare was also really good though I am not sure about their interpretation of a  tartare --- the crispy pastry shell was reminiscent of an egg roll or puff pastry. It was still delicious though the serving size was on the very small side.

Both appetizers came with a side of green salad tossed in probably a basic balsamic or extra virgin olive oil dressing.

For the entree, I asked for the 'grilled romesco muscovy duck', The grilled duck leg was surprisingly fall-off-the-bone tender served with the remesco sauce on top, and sitting on a bed of roasted carrots and baby fingerling potatoes. I loved it though I wish the portions were bigger than that.

The server strongly recommended the lemon tart as it was apparently her favorite. So ordered I did, the lemon tart. My friend ordered the Cheesecake.

The lemon tart lived up to it's billings but I was more pleasantly surprised by the cheese-cake which was probably the best I have ever had. The cream cheese was fluffy and light unlike the dense textures of many others, or the overpowering taste of those at "The Cheesecake Factory"

In Conclusion, I enjoyed the food and great service, but it turned out pretty expensive with the portion sizes leaving quite a bit to be desired - $80 (and we didn't even have alcohol) 

The server was very personable, charming, and pretty efficient in spite of the fact that she was the lone person serving. I'd give her a full 5 stars.
author: Umesh T.

description:
Delicious!!

I ordered the lentil soup and calamari appetizer in a delicious red sauce.

The lentil soup was cooked to perfection and I loved the pita bread!

The calamari was sautéed in a delicious tomato based sauce with sliced artichoke. Simple yet so delicious! 

I absolutely love this place and will be going back regularly as I live down the street from it.
author: Kristina P.

description: Our group of 10 had an awesome time at Dunya!  The service was awesome, the bottomless was great and the food was great too! We had low expectations of the food based on the reviews but everyone was very happy.  They also take reservations which was great for our size group.
author: J P.

description: It has been for a while I am dining at this great Mediterranean bistro, for their casual concept they make you feel almost fine dining experience , with reasonable prices,lamb skewer and Petaluma chicken is my favorite, I am not fan of their rice, maybe I like veggies more then rice!! Service can be much better,Great bistro, for date and casual dining experience!
author: BaRan S.

description:
Very underwhelmed with this place. We were  in line at swan oyster depot but it was kinda long so we decided to check this place out. We ordered...

1. Crispy falafel - very dry and tasteless. It was served with a mixed green salad and doused with some creamy mayonnaise sauce. Presentation was unappetizing and the taste confirmed it.
2. Calamari - not your typical battered and fried calamari but rather sautéed with olive, artichoke hearts in a tomato broth. The calamari actually tasted and smelled fishy so it was probably not very fresh at all. Artichoke wasn't bad but it didn't taste any different than canned artichoke. I really couldn't stand to eat more than one bite of the calamari 
3. Mixed grill - we wanted to try all the different kabobs so we ordered the mixed grill which was a sample of 4 different kabobs. The chicken was probably the best out of the 4...fairly well seasoned but a bit overcooked but not bad at all. The spicy group beef n lamb kabobs n regular beef n lamb kabobs were a bit gamey and dry. The beef kabob was really dry. We had to order a side if tzaiki to make it slightly more edible. 

Overall the food is 1 star but the service wasn't terrible so I gave it 2 stars I would not come here again and I'm confused by the 4 star review on yelp. Next time I'll just practice a little more patience and wait in the long line instead
author: Mai C.

description:
I am a huge fan of breakfast potatoes and consider myself something of an expert on the subject . Home fries can make or break a meal--this is serious. The "country potatoes" served on the side of all the egg dishes at Dunya are tops in my book. Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside...I nom them HARD. Bfri loves the Stuffed Falafel Salad. Service can be slow at times, but the staff is always super nice. Definitely a solid place to stop for brunch on Polk Street. 

Minus one star because the mimosas (although bottomless at brunch) sometimes leave something to be desired. Not enough bubbles..too much Tang!
author: Heather E.

description: FANTASTIC atmosphere, food and drinks were. So happy we decided to come here for bottomless mimosas. Our server Achmed was very attentive and helpful at recommending menu items. Can't wait to come back next time we're in town!
author: Chloe M.

description: Ordered the prosciutto and salmon omlettes. Both were tasteless and skimpy on the fillings. Best part of the meal was the white Spanish wine. Not sure why this place has overall 4 stars. And the waiter never checked on us. Won't return.
author: Gary P.

description: This place has great ambiance and food without the ridiculous wait lines like everywhere else in the area.  The service staff is knowledgeable and makes pretty great recommendations.
author: Shubhra S.

description:
I recently watched this restaurant go from a closed up empty shop to a brand new restaurant in about a month and decided I had to try it.  Anything that says "Mediterranean" and "wine bar" quickly catches my attention!

The menu is very creative, making choosing just one meal difficult!  The food here was incredible.  The bread and organic butter to start with were very good- we asked for a second plate!  I had the Hearts of Romaine salad, which was only $5 and listed in starters but was definitely large enough for a meal.  I was impressed with how creatively the salad was done- it had mango salsa mixed in, which tasted great.  My boyfriend had the Pomegranate Kobe Sirloin Steak and was very impressed.  The steak was $17, but definitely worth it.  Their lunch prices are also great- the steak at lunchtime is only $9 or $10.

After how impressed we were with dinner, we went for dessert - a cheesecake with berries and red wine sauce - and we were very impressed.  Dunya only has one dessert a night, but I would definitely try it whatever it is because everything we had tasted great!

The ambiance of the restaurant is nice.  Smaller, with a wine bar in the back as well as tables of various sizes.  The wait staff also was very friendly.  We quickly decided this was one of the top three, if not the top, restaurants we've been to in San Francisco.  We will definitely be back on a regular basis!  This place is sure to become a huge success.
author: Rachael M.

description: THE WORST MEDITERRANEAN FOOD EVER!!! I went there with my girlfriend and it was big big mistake !!!! I ordered lentil soup and soup was so salty. I couldn't finish it. And for share mix green salad and in the salad mango was almost turned green . And I ordered chicken kebab . Chicken was over cooked and it was so hard like a rubber. Rice was hard and undercook  And my girlfriend ordered  lamb kebap. And also, lamb kebap was overcooked and there was a hair inside of the dish. Disgusting food and restaurant !  It was the worst Mediterranean and Turkish food I've ever had !!!
author: Görkem A.

description: I had a quick dinner and definitely met my expectations. I ordered the lamb kebab: a generous portion with veggies and rice. All very tasty and flavourful. I'll come back to give more dishes a try and hopefully rate it higher!
author: Pablo N.

description:
I have lived down the street from Dunya for some time now and finally managed to stop by for dinner this weekend. I was meeting some friends who had been out watching football all day and were a little rowdier than normal, but they set us up at the long high top table and managed us just fine. Props for that. 

A friend and I shared the Mezze Platter (my kinda meal) with the calamari. I loved the hummus and the tzatziki, and their stuffed grape leaves were standard. My boyfriend had the lamb burger which I stole a bite of: if you are looking for some serious meaty indulgence I would highly recommend this...yum. For a small place, I was surprised to see their wine list had a nice variety and reasonable prices. If you are even slightly tempted by dessert, get the baklava. I will say no more. 

I'll have to stop by for happy hour, they have a fab deal: $10 glass of wine + app! Can't beat it.
author: Rosie C.

description: Great place to stop in early on a lazy Saturday.  Came in at 4pm for a glass of wine and also ordered the Mezze plate, which was phenomenal.  Good prices and service. We'll be back if we're in the area.
author: Thea M.

description:
We ended up at this spot last night since I was searching for a place that would have veggie friendly options for someone in our group. I've gotta say everything was great. We started out with the Mezze platter which was perfect for about 4 people to nibble on. And then just b/c it looked interesting I ordered the calamari - it was in a delicious tomato based sauce and really tender. 

For the mains we had most of the stuff on the menu at the table. I had the petalum chicken which came in a perfectly spiced sauce and was actually not dry. The others at the table ordered  -

-the mixed platter - the boys enjoyed this one. all meat if thats what you're in the mood for
-the stuffed falafel- my friend loved this. the "stuffed" part is that there's goat cheese in the middle. We decided that goad cheese is like bacon for vegetarians (it makes everything taste better). 
- the lamb kabob - flavor was great but a touch dry 
-the mousakkah - this one was not liked. a bit to muchy and flavorless
-red snapper- not a bite left on the plate =)

For desserts we did a sharing of the
-chocolate dome- deliciously chocolaty without being too much
-mango panacotta- my personal fav. this had something in it that added a little fizz. no idea what it was but tasty with the addition of pistachios
-the baklava- different that your standard piece of rectangle baklava - everyone enjoyed this one 

They only serve beer and wine but their selection is pretty good - and their wine pour is like 1/2 a bottle! 

Overall this is a great spot- I don't know that I'd be back on my own, but thats only b/c theres way too many places to try in SF.
author: Komal B.

description: I've always loved coming to Dunya and enjoy everything on the menu. My favorite is the mezze platter because it has all the dips and it's fun to share! Tonight, I had a really great experience with our server Carlos. I ordered the lentil soup and when he came to clear the plates he noticed I hadn't touched too much of it. He asked me if I didn't like it and I was hesitant to answer at first, but was honest and said it was a little tomatoey for me. He told me he'd take it off our bill and insisted even when I said I would pay for it. It meant a lot that he went the extra mile to notice and I will continue to come back for the great food and amazing customer service!!
author: Jess C.

description: I was ther lastnight with my roommate. All i can say is this place is amazing to have dinner with great selections of wine, fabulous ambiance ,fabulous service  .i  will definitely come back.
author: Hamzah A.

description: I ate here as part of a group of four on a Saturday evening. We shared a mixed platter to start and some filo pastries filled with cheese, which I found to be excessively rich. The platter was good to share, but the pitta bread was very soft and doughy. I enjoyed the lamb kebab as my main, as it was full of flavour and complimented well by veg and rice- I strongly recommend this. I had the chocolate dessert option which was great. Overall, good food, clean, pleasant ambience and attentive service. Prices seemed just right.
author: Barry O.

description:
Funny how you can walk past a place dozens (perhaps hundreds!?) of times and never notice it.  I am sad to say that happened to me with Dunya as I went here for the first time last night after living two blocks from Polk for over a year and a half!  

Cute little place on Polk just a couple doors down from Bob's Donuts.  It's pretty dark and not on a corner is I guess how I missed it until my roommate recommended we go.  I definitely will be back.  

We had some hummus & pita appetizer; the pitas were maybe the best I have ever had.  I also really enjoyed the Petaluma Chicken and appreciated that they were willing to accommodate a substitution request.  Food was very fresh and portion sizes generous.

The service was fast and friendly & the waiter did a nice job recommending some wine, of which they have a very wide selection.  They had signs advertising a few events such as flamenco dancing every other Wednesday.  

The atmosphere is casual but decently classy -- perhaps a good place to bring a date.  Dunya is pretty small (although comparable to a lot of other places on Polk) and has very low lighting.  They have a TV or 2 at the bar for watching sports etc.
author: Molly B.

description: This place is amazing. Me and couple of friends had a brunch today. Everything was perfect. I enjoyed the food and the talk. Thx a loooot. We will be back for sure and i  higly recommend this place to everyone :)
author: Alvy S.

description:
Solid 3.5 for food and rounded up for service and ambiance!
Searched small plates on Yelp and found this tuck away. Super cute and close to other bars! Went with a date and it was a good date place! Not overly intimate and not overly lively. Liked it! Plates were hardly small...BUT def not complaining:-)

Ordered the Tzatziki, which you have option of adding veggies with pita. Nice touch! Their recipe is on the thick, creamy side. Good with food, not a stand alone.

Goat cheese stuffed falafel salad- Really good! But I am definitely biased because anything goat cheese stuffed is a winner in my mouth! 

Salmon kebab- had a lemony sauce that was a nice touch. Fresh! Not overly seasoned, just fresh and healthy. 

Lamb meatballs- ehh! Just OK! 

Calamari- Jammin! Really Good! Would order again!

The best part... wine selection is just right! Bottles are super cheap and probably the best value over the by the glass menu! Yep, I'll be back with friends!
author: Gina H.

description: Wandered into Dunya with two friends after grabbing a few drinks on Polk Street.  The atmosphere is perfect for a date night, and the wait staff was very attentive.  The wine selection was OK, and the food was about average for Mediterranean food in the bay area.  Prices were very reasonable for the portions of food.  We split the Calamari Palermo which was FANTASTIC and the I had the Lamb Meatballs as my entree.  The meatballs were okay and the pita bread was pretty bad, but the good atmosphere and the calamari would bring me back in if I ever happened to be in the area without dinner plans.
author: Raina D.

description: Oh Dunya, what a nice surprise on a beautiful SF Sunday morning!  My friend and I tried to get into some of the more well-known brunch spots in the Tender Nob/Polk Street area, but they all had loooong waits as in 30+ minutes...Since we did not have that much time to wait around we targeted a place that would look good with a decent menu and that is when Dunya happened.  We got seated at the bar right away...Oh my, the food was awesome.  I ordered the corned beef hash with poached eggs...this hash is like you have never experienced before as it is not creamy buy chunky, delish!  Everything was great, except we had to wait for an unusual long time for the food and the service was so so at best...but definitely a great brunch spot in SF.
author: Adriana P.

description: Took take-away, they charged me for yogurt sos. Which I believe should come free for a turkish food that normally comes with yoghurt as a side. Food was only ok.
author: Duygu I.

description:
The entire team at Dunya is incredible.  My first experience was a year ago when visiting the bay area for a family wedding - we stopped in for a glass of wine during happy hour to celebrate with the bride.  I recalled a warm and cozy, romantic ambiance.  So when my partner and i visited San Francisco for a long weekend we tried it at the recommendation of our hotel concierge.  It wasn't long before we both fell in LOVE with this place.  

On our first visit (yes, we ended up eating three times at Dunya) we dropped by for a late afternoon snack. Our server helped us to select a great glass of wine to accompany the fantastic tapas we enjoyed.  We were very satisfied indeed.  And when he offered the dessert menu we had no idea we about to meet our biggest delight: the baklava.  Theirs has a special lemon sauce, which made it hands down the best we've ever had.  

At brunch today before leaving to return home, my partner asked for cream (not milk) for his coffee.  After clearing up they only had milk, our waitress offered to go to the cafe NEXT DOOR and get cream.  She literally walked out with a creamer in hand and returned with it to our table.  We were simply astounded at her kindness.  

Suffice it to say we had nothing but great experiences, and truly believe this is an establishment that is invested in the happiness of their customers.  Thank you, we'll be back soon!
author: Mark H.

description:
Terrible service. Two of us got in 10 minutes before another group of 4. We were seated at the bar and were told to wait for tables to be cleaned up. We looked around and found 2 vacant 2-person tables and a 4-person table with a lot of empty plates. Then the group of 4 came, the table was instantly cleaned up and they were seated. We waited for another 10 minutes before being ushered to one of the empty tables. I ordered a cup of coffee while sitting at the bar but it never showed up. After sitting down for 15 minutes, nobody even stopped by to give us the menus. At the same time the group of 4 were ordering with the waiters.

This kind of service made us just speechless. We stood up and left right then.
author: Wei W.

description:
Comida riquísima!!! Y muy buen servicio!!! -my Aunt.

Honestly, the service here is awesome, so friendly and attentive to customers. The musakka was super tasty and delicious. On the smaller side, but definitely cozy and a nice atmosphere to sit and chat, sip wine, and enjoy an authentic meal. The dessert was to diiiie for, my group had the tiramisu and baklava, it was scrumptious!!! Love it! Will come back.
author: Kelly P.

description:
My boyfriend and I stopped in on a whim. It looks inviting, delicious and I love Greek food!

Service was awesome at first but after we got our wine and ordered our food it was crappy.

The food was nothing to write home about and the baklava was stale. If you're a Greek restaurant how in the world can you not nail baklava!!

Needless to say I left very disappointed.
author: Cassy R.

description:
Great little place on Polk street.

Decent wine selection and prices. Fast and friendly service.

I went there for brunch, and I got the Huevos eggs with hummus and flatbread..very delicious! A nice little Greek twist on a classic Cali-Mex Breakfast item.

The sides of potatoes was okay. I wish it was crispier and had more flavoring.

I loved the decour very nice. The front bell motif is cool, but less beams would be nicer. it makes the entryway look a bit out of place compared to the rest of the place.
author: Michele W.

description:
Haven't been to this place yet?  Well that's OK, I've Dunya homework for you.

The first time I visited Dunya was a year + ago, right when it opened.  Although the branding on the window read "Mediterranean Cusine," I was surprised to find that the menu was pretty much straight Californian.  My lady friend and I thought it might have been left over from the defunct hookah bar that used to be there.  But it would be crazy to think they wouldn't have simply razor-bladed those off before opening.  But I digress....

We recall the Californian-style food being decent, but nothing we tasted really flew the ole flag.  We ventured back for a sophomore effort a few weeks later, but I still found myself leaving with a similar lukewarm feeling.  

So, why the 5 start rating then?  Well, cut to a year later and one night, while brainstorming spots to eat dinner on Polk, I surprisingly hear myself suggest Dunya to my girlfriend.  She agrees and we saunter on down.  We walk in and are seated immediately.  As we look at the menu, we realize that it's completely different from what it once had been.  Instead of the California cuisine I was expecting, it was now Mediterranean.  At first I was a touch wary, b/c I was expecting Californian.  But after a glance over at the window where I spotted the familiar "Mediterranean Cuisine" branding, all was right in the world b/c it finally matched.

This place is remarkable for a handful of reasons.  First off, and most importantly, the food is damn tasty.  Lots of great flavors going on.  Between the two of us, we've tried pretty much everything on the menu and everything is spectacular.   Second, the menu has a lot of variety.  It walks the line perfectly between offering a good number of options without being too busy.  Third, the prices are extremely reasonable, which kind of blows my mind b/c the food is quality.  Fourth, they actually PLATE their food.  I love that.  Fifth, and this actually happened when I first went a year back, they had my favorite wine on special there - Haraszthy's 2008 Old Vine Zin.  If you haven't tried it, give this wine a go.  It's unreal.  Sixth, the waitstaff is attentive and quite handsome.

Do yourself a favor and check it out.
author: Erik L.

description:
this is the best restaurant i have ever eaten. Wooohooo. i am so happy to been there.
Best Mediterranean restaurant I've been to thus far. I'm digging their menu and I'm loving the atmosphere. The restuarant is small and cozy, intimate but also has a casual-friendly  vibe. Also the prices are reasonable. I am so happy to found this amazing restaurant. Perfect for date night or a place to bring parents!
Just give a shot this amazing place and you will definitely love it. 
by the way the owner is so friendly. Thank for everything. i will definitely come back again again again.
author: Jean K.

description:
I always walk past this place on my way to Toast or Swan Oyster Depot and it always sounded good/interesting but not good enough to sway me from my original destination. Finally after months of stopping to read the menu but not going in, I decided to check it out. It was late afternoon, well past the traditional lunchtime so it was pretty empty and I figured I should be able to get my food quickly. 

I pretty quickly figured out that i was not going to get my food in a timely manner. While I was greeted quickly and given a menu, placing a drink order or even getting the server's attention took forever. Unfortunately he was the only person manning the floor and had to juggle his duties as the bartender, waiter and busboy. It took about half an hour to place my order and get a drink and an order of dolma. At this point, the place was getting 3 stars in my head (poor service but tasty food and drink).

About 45 minutes in, I got my plate. It was wrong. I had clearly asked for chicken kabobs but was given lamb (during the order taking process, I repeated chicken three times and before he left the table, the server repeated the order back to me as chicken. He then somehow forgot this exchange in the three steps it took him to walk to the grill man). If the mistake had been pretty much any other type of protein I would've just eaten it, but sadly he had picked lamb, the one protein I most definitely did not want for a late lunch. I tried to get his attention, to no avail. Finally I got up and bought the plate over to him at the bar. At this point, my rating had fallen down to one star and I was pretty sure there was no recovery.

He quickly offered to remake the order correctly. I sat down for 10 minutes and started to feel unwell since I had only eaten dolma and drank a glass of mimosa and really needed to raise my blood sugar with some real food fast. I went back over to the bar and told him to cancel the order and to just give me the check since I figured the chicken redo was probably going to take another 10 minutes and waffles at Toast was starting to sound a lot faster and less annoying by the second. He got me my check and my remade order packed to go and told me my order was on the house since he had made the mistake (hmmm... back up to two stars for great customer service skills of fixing a mistake). I was slightly suspicious of eating the remade order but was so hungry that I scarfed it down when I got home. It was delicious. If I were just judging the food, this place would have four stars. But for the whole ordeal I have to give it three stars.

I would go here again. The food is great and even though the server made a pretty big  mistake, he made a great recovery and everyone is entitled to an off day.
author: Dani D.

description:
Was walking my way to Swan Oyster Depot when I realized it's closed on Sunday.
Kept going on Polk until I stumbled across this place which aroused my curiosity. I almost didn't go in due to the 3.5 rating, but you know what.. That's just ain't fair.

Got to say, unjustified 3.5.
While it's definitely not perfect, everything I ate was good and the place has a good vibe to it.
We had the platter, lentil soup and falafel wrap all great. 

Was debating whether a 4 or a 5 will do, but decided 5 will help bump the place up to his 4 stars rightful place.
author: Assaf B.

description:
This place has potential. I would definitely come back to try their bottomless mimosa brunch.

Atmosphere: cozy and a bit romantic...nicely decorated with dim lighting. 

Service: we didn't have a reservation on a Monday night at 7 and we were sat right away. Our waiter did take about 5 minutes to address us at all, but a bus boy brought us waters and menus so it was fine. When the waiter did show up he was very was on the eyes : ) He recommended the calamari, the feta prawns, the salmon and the stuffed eggplant. 

Food and wine: I ordered a glasses of cab by glass (they have about 10 wines to pick from by glass and the rest are by bottle...it's only one option per type of wine) They were out of the cab it turns out..and instead of offering me some of one of the cabs that only come by bottle, he offered me a glass of the zin that was by glass...I'm a simple girl so I agreed...but I know this would have bothered some people : /

We split the calamari and I had the stuffed eggplant and my friend had the lamb burger. Neither one of us made and comments about our dishes at dinner. Mine was just ok...it had layers of a red sauce and a béchamel sauce but somehow it didn't have much flavor. I wanted to ask for salt (which was not in the table) but I didn't want to be "rude". It was a large portion though...definitely enough for two. 

Overall: nice simple place I go to dinner. I'm not positive that I would cab it from Soma for this destination...but if I was on Polk again already I would definitely stop in and give it another shot. 

Price: all entrees range from $10-15 which was nice and appetizer are $6-12ish depending on what you choose. Wine by the glass is $8-10.
author: Juliet S.

description: I really wanted to like this place, but the staff makes it incredibly hard. We came here for brunch, sat outside. Food was pretty good, but service was terrible. Somehow the waiter thought it was ok to wipe the table with a napkin that he then say our silverware on. It was hard to get anyone's attention. We won't be going back.
author: Jesse N.

description:
I love this place!

Also great service and great wine selection.  This is my favorite Mediterranean restaurant in the city so far and one of the only places I can order salmon off the menu and know they will cook it properly.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Who knew a stuffed falafel salad would be so yummy? I didn't, considering I'm not a huge fan of falafels in the first place. But stuffed with cheese and surrounded by lettuce and guacamole? Yes please. I also got the pleasure of enjoying their calamari, which is always a good idea. The appetizer portions are also huge. Two apps was plenty to share between two people and result in a full stomach. 
So food? Check.
However, I went there simply to drink wine. Their Chenin Blanc is amazingly refreshing and smooth. I got two glasses, just because. 
The bartender was smokin' hot. Enjoying a glass of wine after work and checking him out was definitely worth it. 
The place itself is cute and really close to my place, so it will be a neighborhood fav.
author: Sonya D.

description: Good chicken kebab! The cheese boreks were ok, they used the egg roll wrappers instead of better dough. Service was slow on Saturday night, one waitress for the entire place but would go back and try another time.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
So my friends and I wanted to go to brunch on an early, recent Sunday afternoon.  All the usual diners and boutique restaurants were packed to the gills, and we traipsed over to this unsuspecting little bistro-esque place called Dunya.  Compared to the other spots we passed on our walk, Dunya was surprisingly empty.

Their brunch menu looked really appetizing, especially the medium-sized array of omelettes they have available.  I personally ordered the three eggs any style breakfast, and that's where the service went downhill.  I ordered my eggs over easy, and all three of them were slightly overcooked.  Not a good thing at all!  I like my eggs gooey and dripping with that marigold-colored yolk!  On top of this, they gave me ONE slice of toast cut in half...yes, ONE SLICE!  Now, when you order your eggs over easy, you should get one slice of toast PER egg.  That's standard, and yes, it takes exactly one slice of toast to mop up one over easy egg.  The fact that they gave me only one slice of toast period was extremely aggravating.
