The only good thing about the place was the bottomless mimosas for $12.  Bloody Mary's were also listed right next to the mimosas on the menu for $5, but they weren't bottomless.  Judging from their placement on the menu, they really should be, but I digress.

So overall, this place gets one star for the bottomless mimosas and another star for the appetizing menu.  That's all.  



Didya go to Dunya?  Yes, I did, and it's one and dun!
author: Paul D.

description: We went for late night dinner when a lot of the places around were closed or not suitable for dining with 3 year old. This places was open and we were greeted at the door and immediately seated, So many * for just that. Waiter was very attentive and we got our food in reasonable time. Food was great!
author: Jag M.

description:
We were in the neighborhood and decided to try Dunya. We got street parking, but if you're not so lucky there is a garage around the corner on Sacramento, The restaurant was a tad chilly and it took a while for my ears to accept the volume of the music. 

The glass of  wine was multi-sensational. We shared the Dolma appetizer, and found it to be the best we'd had. My Beyti (minced beef and lamb, wrapped lavash, tomato sauce and yogart) was "good" to "very good." I felt slighted on vegetables compared to my wife's plate. Her Adana Kebab (ground beef and lamb, roasted red bell peppers) came with a generous serving of  vegetables and rice. The seasoning was exquisite, she said her mouth was orgasmic and she did not want to brush her teeth for days (just kidding).

Am I the only one who is put off by the bill suggesting how much to tip?! The service was "good," but nothing to rave about.

Bottom line: we'll eat here again.
author: Wayne J.

description:
hella bread and hummus for a $5 appetizer.

came in for a for a quick lunch break to get some food.  i asked the cashier what was his favorite appetizer.  he just handed me the menu said here are the appetizers.  so i had to ask him again for his suggestion, because i'm not picky.  then he told me he doesnt know what i like.  grrrr..   i just want to know what he likes so i can order it, because the employees know best..right??    so i just told him to get me what most people like as an appetizer and of course it was the hummus.  the bread was soft, fluffy, and slightly sweet.  the hummus was alright, a very plain jane choice, but it was very filling.  i appreciate that they did not drown it in a pool of oil.    totally got sick of it by the end of my meal.

probably would not come back...
author: Tina A.

description: A Mediterranean restaurant and a wine bar. Two of my favorite things. I tried this place just cause of that, and yes the food and wine were good, but service could be better.
author: Pam Y.

description:
I went Dunya with my wife and loved everything I tried. Rib-eye was perfectly prepared..

Great Food, great service, great desert..

We will definitely be coming back..
author: YL B.

description: had the salmon with vermicelli, pretty good, had some nice veggies with it.  sat at the bar, service was just average, seemed that the waiter/bartender had an attitude, he could've been french?  asked for water, didn't come, had to ask again, it was given to me silently, okay...
author: Jeff H.

description:
Seriously one of my new favorite places on Polk. How did I not know about this for 4yrs living in the neighborhood? Amazing Mediterranean food, attractive servers, delicious wines, layed back yet classy atmosphere all at reasonable prices ..good deal to me. 

For dinner try the falafel salad (falafel balls stuffed with goat cheese), tzatziki, salmon carpaccio & feta prawns. And don't miss the Zinfandel. Thinking about it makes me want a glass. Now. 

There's only one larger group table, so it's best to come with 2-4 people. Make a reservation and get seated right away or you could wait a bit. Can't wait to try this place for brunch or lunch.
author: Natalie H.

description:
My boyfriend and I decided to finally go here last night after walking past a million times and commenting that we needed to try it - but never actually did.

I'm REALLY glad we came here.  The place is amazing.  The hummus plate and warm pita bread is highly recommended as an appetizer.  My boyfriend had the lamb and said it was amazing.  I had the Vegan Pyramid and I almost pooped my pants it was so good.  Then we decided we should probably share two desserts because - ya know - we hadn't had enough to eat yet apparently.  We had the chocolate mousse and the baklava.  Both REALLY good.  And the servers were all so nice.  

We stuck to beer but but it's a wine bar and had a huge selection of wines.  

Definitely my new place!!
author: Erin D.

description: I came with my boyfriend for an early dinner.  I had heard from my friends that their wine selection was very good and I'm a sucker for mediterranean food. So I figured, why not? The waitress was extremely helpful with suggestions and was super attentive.  Everything came out in a timely fashion and was super delicious! My favorite were the lamb kebabs.  Juicy and seasoned to perfection! The petite Syrah went perfect with it all.  Will definitely be back. Great food and great service!
author: C M.

description: Don't waste your time or money for the $12 bottomless mimosa. Unless of course you want terrible service. We saw the bottoms of our champagne glass so many times and had to ask them to fill it. On top of that, the guy dropped a utensil on me as he was cleaning the table. The reaction was not of concern for the guest (me) at the very least.
author: Z C.

description: 5 stars for the beautifully presented and delicious food, our server Leonardo's welcoming personality and ensuring our mimosas and water were filled to the brim at all times, and for being allowed to linger after we finished our meal. We ended up staying well over 2 hours and even made new acquaintances with the people sitting next to us. This was one of the most fun and relaxing Sunday brunches I have ever had. Thank you Dunya - we will definitely come back for more!
author: Elaine W.

description:
I have high standards when it comes to Mediterranean food, and the lamb burger and falafel I had here over the weekend deserved a solid 5 stars.  Both were delicious and I can't wait to have them again.  

The hummus, on the other hand, was pretty awful.  It had no flavor and was swimming in either really low quality olive oil which is just bad, or canola oil, which is even worse.  It just tasted cheap and we didn't even eat it.  I'm pretty sure Safeway hummus is better.  So disappointing.
author: Nicole G.

description:
Hands down my favorite brunch spot on the planet.

The food is incredible and especially the brunch food: Mediterranean eggs.  Hummus, mozzarella, pita, oh my.  

The atmosphere is really nice, chill, very pub in Ireland.
author: Rimi K.

description: The food here was good and the service was exceptional. It was very cozy and the decor was decent. Prices were very reasonable and portions were enough to satisfy my hunger. Great place to try.
author: Daniel C.

description:
I went to Dunya for lunch today, and it was probably THE WORST dining experience in my life.

It basically started when I tried to redeem my Google Offer ($5 off over $20 spent).  The Google offer is of standard fare that everyone receives via Gmail or Google Offer App on the iPhone.  

After finishing my less than mediocre lunch, I presented my Google Offer (per the instructions, the Offer says to present to the waiting staff after the meal when he/she could mark the Offer as used).  At first the waiter said he had to check with his manager, so  I waited a few minutes for the anticipated confirmation.  To my disappointment, he emerged from the back and indicated that the Google Offer is invalid and they don't have any deal with Google. I was like WTF, then why would Google be putting this out for the general public?? I politely asked the waiter to recheck with the manager. Again he emerged and said they cannot provide $5 off and that I would have to pay the full price.  I was not happy and demand to see the manager.

Instead the "owner" of Dunya got up from the table across from us (he was eating with his friends and witnessed the entire discussion) and reiterated that they cannot honor the Google Offer. He insisted that I take up the issue with Google.  This is when the shouting match began... I was irate that the owner of the restaurant was asking me, the customer, to resolve a problem that was clearly Dunya's to fix.  Does the owner of Dunya not understand the basics of business, i.e. the customer is always right? Over $5, the customer should always be right!!  The argument heated up as I tried to explain to him this is not my problem, but a problem that he needs to resolve with Google.  He kept indicating that it was MY PROBLEM and that essentially  I should have known better. WTF, how would I know if it shows up in my App?  

He even accused me of applying this ploy to extract a free meal.  My god, this is Dunya we are talking about, not Morton's Steakhouse! He offered me a free dinner with wine (he would open the bottle personally), if I resolve this issue with Google.  Does that even make economic sense? Wouldn't it be better that he provide me $5 off than a free meal with wine? Like most dubious businessmen, the offer of "compensation" was merely hollow words.

Instead of spending another minute chatting with the owner, I paid the FULL amount, excluding tip (I saw the waiter snickering in the back!!!).  I just couldn't take the BS anymore.  I could have left and not paid, but I am a honest person and paid the full amount.  As I left, the owner sat down with friends and continued with the routine like nothing had happen.  They were probably mouthing me off as I left.  I can only imagine what they were saying: "What a dumba@ss. Who uses Google Offers anyways? Groupons are the best" or "Hahaha, you screwed another one! I can't wait for the next guy who tries to use Google Offers.  Who is Google anyway?", or "I don't like the way he wears his pants - only dishonest, freeloaders wear pants that in that manner."

My girlfriend took video of the entire altercation. I would post the video on Yelp, but the feature doesn't exist.  I am usually not the type to say bad things about anyone, but this situation prompted me to write on Yelp.  Hope your day is going well and I hope to god that you don't go to Dunya with a Google Offer! Yelpers don't do that to Yelpers....

Cheers!
author: Thor T.

description: Sigh, yet another confused quasi-near-eastern kinda place bearing the Turkish name of 'the world'.  Lamb meatballs, kabobs, rice, shrimp, ya...I've seen it all before, and its as good as the next place doing an average job.   And how did salmon become a staple on the menu here...at the very least, it you wanna stay local, offer halibut or something that might have a cousin swimming in the Med.
author: David S.

description: Pretty decent selection of wine. Good location, tasty appetizers and nice interior with very cozy atmosphere.
author: Kseniya S.

description: Been here for brunch, the food is great the wait is not. I came here a few weeks ago and our food took about 30 minutes to come out.  The worst part was seeing people arrive after us and getting their food way before us and they ordered the same thing. The waiters were neglecting us too so for that 3 stars!
author: Veronica S.

description: Been here a couple times since I moved up, and I'm not quite sure how I feel yet. I love the chicken kabobs, really flavorful and I love the fresh veggies and rice you get on the side to go along with it. Hummus was a little lacking in taste for me, and I remember my friends saying their food (steak, lamb burger) was just average. The kabobs, ambience, and the fact that it's near all the bars keep bringing me back but the service is just way. too. slow.
author: Sam U.

description:
Two little stories for you:

A couple of months ago my friend calls and wants me to go with her to Dunya. During this time I tried out Match for a couple of months, even though my friends were like "You don't live in a mountain or a secluded farm, get out of there". I didn't really understand how the whole winking and favoriting was like. I see this cute guy and silly me decides to send him a wink. Glad he didn't see it in person, because I sort of twitch. At least its better than a Facebook poke, right? Only thing, this guy ignored my existence completely. I am such a dork I thought to myself, but I like to take risks. 

So It's Thursday night and my friend and I walk in and I glanced to my left and see she says hi to the guy in table with 4 other people. I avert my eyes towards him and my jaw just dropped, OMG, it's the wink match guy!!! She introduced us and we all sat in the same table, sat right across from him. I was really hoping this guy did not notice me. But his smirk just sold it, he obviously knew. I started to speak in Spanish to my friend so he would not understand, and actually showed her his match profile on my phone. She was cracking up and before I know it he says "De donde son?" (Where are you from?). He heard us the whole time, because he speaks Spanish!!!! So embarrassing. I chugged about 3 glasses of wine that very moment. Found out he looked at my profile right after that night. He told me in another encounter, "See we didn't need Match to meet." 

A little later my friend and I go to the bar and our friend gives us a glass of  wine to try, which was good in my opinion. My friend says "I don't like it, it sucks" and this older guy out of no where standing next to me says "Hi I'm "Bob. (Don't remember his name) That's my wine. What did you think? " My friend almost spit her wine out and we immediately smiled and said, "Its fantastic!" The guy spoke to us for 20 min and gave us his card, welcoming us to his vineyard in Sonoma anytime. Wow..now I know I can't give an opinion about wine out loud or much less speak in code in another language. Other than that, great ambiance for a date or a chill night out. 

We ordered the Stag's Leap Merlot 2007, Napa Valley with
firm tannins, with aromas of fennel, leather, & cassis as well as the TR Elliott Pinot Noir Burgonet 2006, Russian River Valley with red cherry and dark plum with earthy mushroom, great structure,a soft but sure tannic backbone framed by sweet oak, hummus platter, and an amazing Med dessert. Everything was very good and they have an extensive selection of wines, you must ask for TONY! He is cultural and awesome.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Food was great, service not so much. Server couldn't even be bothered to pick up the check, or give two shits about my dinning experience.
author: Anthony P.

description: Waiters with intense gazes serving you delicious food. The coffee is a drip, but it tastes like a nice french roast. Try the prosciutto omlette.
author: Matt W.

description: Went to Dunya with my mom and brother around 3 pm on a Friday. We were the only ones in the place, but it still took 5 minutes for anyone to notice us. The server did not immediately bring over water- we had to ask. The food was decent but it took a long time to get to our table, and it seemed as though it had been sitting out for a while (which is odd because we were the only people in the whole place). Will not be back.
author: Kate B.

description: Dunya had a very nice menu of options. We decided to order a variety of appetizers and a bottle of wine. Every dish made our taste buds dance! The atmosphere is quaint and cozy. Great place to go with a friend or date because the lighting is just right and you can hear what the person you are with is saying. Our waitress was very patient and attentive!
author: Kathy J.

description: Friendly staff, great breakfast / brunch and relatively cheap. Really good deal on bottomless mimosas.
author: James S.

description: Great food, great wine, great cozy atmosphere plus the owner is amazing and sweet.  Our service was top notch.  I loved every bite of food and enjoyed hanging with friends drinking wine and relaxing.  Love how there was no pressure to send us on our way since we were enjoying our wine and having a great evening.  Love this place and would not hesitate to return - plus their prices are totally reasonable.
author: N. Y.

description: If you enjoy waiting, mediocre food, forced gratuity for poor service, and half your table being served food 15 minutes before the other half...then this is the place for you!! And, if you also fancy receiving onions when  asked for none and a rude waiter then you are in for a special treat!
author: Greatreviewer N.

description:
The appetizer selection is really good. And the prices are even better! Try the hummus. You can't go wrong. 

This is a nice quiet place on Sunday nights to have a couple glasses of wine and catch up with old friends.
author: Katie D.

description:
I came here on a Tuesday night with my sisters to use our groupon for this place.  Had been really interested in trying it, and had heard mixed reviews.  Like previous commenter has stated, for the amount of food you get, as well as the quality of the food, it was pretty sub-par for the price.  We got cold bread and oil when they brought out our water.  To start, we got 3 appetizers for $21, we order the Tuna tartar, the butter lettuce with grill prawn & the Salmon wrap stuffed with crab.  

Tuna tartar barely had any tuna in it, not that you can taste it or see it.  The tomatoes & avocado was bigger then the little amount of tuna.  I've tried many tuna tartar, and this was by far the first that I could NOT taste or see the tuna. 

The butter lettuce with grill prawns (with mango salsa) was decent.  It has two decent amount prawns on it.  

The Salmon was the worst. It was supposed to have crab in it, however, we found out after asking about it, that it was only a spread. The cheese & mixed green over-power whatever crab might have been in it (Look at my pictures). *I have to say, I was really sadly disappointed with this, especially based on the description, it makes it sounds like it will be stuffed with crab and not veggy with a crab spread. Very deceiving. 

The waiter, Rimon, messed up the order, I had order the Seafood risotto and instead of writing it down, he confirm verbally with me twice, and he messed it up writing it down. Before we even finish the appetizer, they brought out the entree, and it was wrong. So, they took it back, then brought only the chicken back. So, only my sister was eating. 

The Petaluma Roasted Chicken was dry.  Having messed up my order for the Seafood risotto, they held the chicken in the back after bringing it out, so it was somewhat cold and dry by the time it got to our table.  The grilled vegetables was also over cooked. 

By the time the Risotto  came, I was expecting redemption, how sadly I was mistaken.  The risotto was hard. Not al dante, but just hard.  The sauce wasn't very good, and one scallop was over cooked.  The portion size was a joke. It would not fill anyone up.  I agree with Kim W.'s review that it lacked flavor, and the shrimp and scallops were mediocre. 

Overall, a sad experience.  I' expressed my disappointed with the place, and the place just disregarded it.  Will not be coming back.  Even with the groupon, it was over priced!
author: Kp P.

description: Veggie tower is delicious!  Healthy and yummy = rare find. Great atmosphere - you're perfect dining alone. Friendly service "Would you like to try the wine?". I left smiling.
author: Kristen B.

description: I only went here for and appetizer and a beer. The staff was so considerate and understanding, not making me feel guilty for only getting an appetizer which a lot of places do. The decor and presentation of food is so elegant and the taste of the food is even better. I was totally in love with this place from the food alone. The Mezze Plater is really something to behold, bites of Dunya's many appetizers. Its actually a good amount of food and every item is so delicious, flavorful and well prepared. Even the bread is nice and warm. This place has the details down to a T. I am definitely coming back for a full meal soon.
author: Dexter H.

description:
Oh, Dunya, how I love you. 

There are so many things that I love about this place other than the amazing food. But while I am talking about the food, you should definitely try out as many things you possibly can on the menu ... it is ALL amazing. You can totally tell that the chef and kitchen staff know what they are doing and care about the food they prepare. Baklava.

The wait staff and owners are delightful and super knowledgeable, and will do whatever they can to accommodate any requests you make ... something that is so refreshing. Baklava.

The ambiance is great--low, romantic-ish lighting, but not so much so that you feel strange popping in with a group of girlfriends, and they have a TV back by the bar if you want to catch whatever game is on while you enjoy some great wine. It definitely has a fun, hip vibe without feeling pretentious. Great place to unwind after a long day at work. Baklava.

Check out their brunch on the weekends--they are generous with the champagne in the mimosas and don't make you ask 7 times for refills like SO many places I have been to in the city. Baklava.

I think the thing I love most about this place is that they remember their patrons and really make you feel welcome and are gracious that they have won your repeat business. Baklava.

There's really nothing that isn't fabulous about Dunya. Def one of my favorites in the city. Baklava.

Baklava.
author: Nikki D.

description: Bartender was kind of a jerk and rushed us from the beginning even though out of a two-top and four-top, we were the third and only new table to be sat for 25 minutes.  Phyllo appetizer was okay, but not worth the price considering what it is. Salmon carpaccio was at least of a decent quality and I enjoyed my lamb shish-kabob. May give it a second chance as I don't think you can judge service off a singular visit. It's takes a lot for me to under tip someone as I approach a 5-strike policy but in this case the guy was rude from start to finish. Until next time.
author: John P.

description:
This place used to have a more of what I'd call Mediterranean fusion menu, which I liked overall. So when they appeared on one of the daily deal site, I got one. 

I let the coupon sit and when I remembered to use it, it turned out their menu has changed. It is now standard Mediterranean fare (not my favourite changes as I wanted something a little different) but the price had gone down considerably (definitely a plus).

Came here for an early dinner with a friend on a weeknight. It was definitely not busy. 

The food was reasonably priced. We were completely stuffed from an appetizer sampler ($15), shrimp kebab ($13) and pasha bayildi ($11). I'd normally try to spend more than what my coupon covers, $40 in this case but the portion were pretty big so that was pretty impossible with two people.

I enjoyed some dishes in the sampler and left some others. The falafel, eggplant salad, hummus and ezme were good but we weren't too crazy about the haydari,  piyaz and sigara boregi.

The prawn kebab had 6 sizable prawns, nicely grilled and great with a splash of the grilled lemon wedges that came on the skewers. I did leave about half of the pasha bayildi for 1) I was full and 2) I found the tomato sauce smothered the flavour of the eggplant, a favourite vegetable of mine (well, technically a fruit). 

When paying, the server charged the tax twice on the bill, once before tip and once after (since the coupon specified a fixed gratuity). I pointed out to him and he went back to fix the problem. 

It appeared to be just a genuine mistake as he stood there for a few minutes trying to fix it and had to call the owner over. The owner explained it was because we spent less than the coupon's face value and the computer did not quite work that way. From the look, he definitely wasn't happy about how we didn't spend extra and never really cracked a smile.
author: Cindy B.

description: I ordered salmon, and it was delicious, althought the bottom was a little too burnt for my liking. The sauce was amazing, the veggies were cooked perfectly, and the appetizer pita/hummus was also amazing. My husband got the chicken shish and his meat was a tiny bit dry...  Solid service, great ambiance.
author: Sophie H.

description:
Came here on a Friday night because we had a restaurant.com coupon and wanted to check the place out.  NOTE:  They ended up at the end of our meal not accepting the Restaurant.com coupon, which I thought was in pretty poor taste.  They said they don't accept them anymore, when clearly we had purchased ours a couple of weeks ago, which isn't our fault.  That kind of put a damper on the whole experience, but that isn't saying anything about the food, wine, or service.

Everything up to the point of paying the check was fabulous.  We had some Calamari, Ezme, and got the lamb kebab and Beyti for our entrees.  Everything was just delicious.  Really, really good food, great service, super cool space.  Really dug this place.  5 stars all the way for everything as far as I'm concerned, I just had to go with 4 stars due to them not accepting our coupon.  It's a very reasonably priced place as well, so it wasn't about the money, it was just the coupon aspect was misleading and was the motivation for us coming to check out the place and order more food than we normally would (minimum purchase on coupon).  So yeah, really thought the place was great, I just wish they'd think before they stop honoring coupons people have already purchased.
author: Sean H.

description: Love love love! The food is amazing, very quite and cute, service was perfect, all in all, a very nice time. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu, but the hummus and falafel is delicious. Go before the dinner rush since there are limited seats available but the wait is worth it. Great place for a few friends to get together at, or a romantic date!
author: Marie F.

description: Food was good, but not excellent. However brunch on Saturday and Sunday with unilmited mimosas for $15 makes it well worth it.
author: John L.

description:
I think this place is a fab little find....thanks you restaurant.com (even though those gift certificates are not valid at Dunya anymore!)

The waiter/host was super nice and adorable and comp'ed us a delicious hummus/babaganoush/yogurt platter because of the restaurant.com mixup. We were all very pleased with our meal -- I consider myself quite the lamb connoisseur, and I completely approved of their lamb shish-kebab (although you have to request it well-done unless you like it medium-rare inside). Each dish came with a side of ride and butter-cooked vegetables, both of which were fantastic. My roommates got the vegetarian appetizer platter dish and the chicken wrap, both of which they said were great!

I know this is a wine bar, so next I come here with my roommates we will probably try the wine+appetizers (which are large in portion).

Worth a visit, and many more after that!
author: Meghana D.

description:
Last night my daughter took our family to Dunya for my birthday.  It was the first time we'd been there.

We were very pleased with the service from both Elisa and the bus boy whose name we didn't get.  The service was extremely professional and attentive when needed. The food was awesome.  We enjoyed everything we got including 6 starters and 3 entrees. 

The atmosphere is lovely.  The music was a bit loud, so we asked Alisa to turn it down so we could talk without yelling.

We had a wonderful experience and will return.  The food is delicious.  It's nice to have another restaurant that offers free-range, grass-fed, organic, and/or local products with a great cook.  Thanks.  - Was only disappointed that they didn't have the lamb dish with goat cheese that they had on the online menu. . . New chef doesn't make it anymore.
author: Marcia G.

description:
I had to hit the bank today and on my way back to the office I decided to try Dunya. I have not had a Mediterranean snack in a while and I tend to pass this place on several occasions so I decided to pop in. The place was empty, but it was 3pm so I can kind of understand. I ordered the Adana Kebab Wrap (Charcoal ground lamb and beef  with Parsley, red onion and spices). This came with fries and a green salad. Overall I wasn't blown away but I wasn't expecting to be. The meat was a little dry for my liking. The fries were seasoned with  garlic and probably parsley. I would have liked to have some ketchup with them. (I thought it was inside my to-go box, but I was wrong... should have checked.) The green salad had a pretty good dressing. 

Overall I'd say this place is just OK. Don't think ill be back but if your looking for a moderate priced lunch ($8.50). Give it a whirl, and don't forget to ask for ketchup :-)
author: Miguel V.

description:
So a girl friend and I came here on a friday night after seeing a movie at the lumiere.  We didn't have reservations but we walked by, it looked good, and they were able to put us at a communal high top without a wait.  Had we had a wait we probably would have left, and that woudn't have been such a bad thing.  

The volume in this place gets out of control.  Now, I will blame some of that on the three ladies to our right, knee deep in vino, who spoke to each other as if they had to compete with a jet taking off, but this place just gets too loud.  My friend and I couldn't talk, at all.  And if you know me and my friend...we talk... The waiter had to ask us to repeat what we wanted on the menu three times before we just finally pointed.  We felt that both of our foods were decent, she got the lamb burger (which she said was very lamby...take what you want from that, sounds good if you like lamb, then again no one likes thier fish to be too fishy)...I got the mousakka.  The prices were affordable, for san francisco mediterranean, the ambiance dim and red....and you kind of felt that at any moment belly dancers might appear (but they didn't)...and all in all it had a lot going for it.  I might try it again, either for brunch, or maybe on a tuesday night...at 4pm...when it isn't as crowded...
author: Kierstan G.

description:
I love this place!  I live nearby and have come here to eat several times, and to drink new wines, even more!  

The hummus is great, the garlic fries are amazing.  They beyti is my absolute favorite and a MUST try!  Spicy, but not too much, perfect flavors.  Had never heard of it before coming here but I will definitely be having this again.

Prawns Shish Kebab was another dish I tried...this is a lighter dish and I'd suggest getting a starter as well.  The owners are friendly, and, as someone else mentioned, get to know their regulars.  I constantly see the chef in front of the restaurant and he always looks so happy waving hello - really makes you feel welcome here.  

Great place to come and unwind, quite reasonably priced as well!  Just learned they also do take out orders.  Color me excited.
author: Janelle C.

description: The happy hour is great here! 3-6 and $10 for an appetizer and full glass of wine.  I had the falafel and they were tasty. It came on a plate of salad too! I got the chicken kebabs to go and they smelled delish and tasted delicious! Glad to know about this restaurant!
author: Natalie S.

description:
Best neighborhood eatery in Nob Hill! I'm here at least once a week and never walk away disappointed.  My friend and I always order the Stuffed Falafel salad, the Feta Prawns app  and an entree to accompany it. The perfectly sized portions make them ideal to share and the flavors are always fantastic--it's no surprise really, why we come back so often. That and the staff is amazing as well :)

The selection of wines is another added bonus, as there is a wide variety to choose from and sure to please any experienced palette. With all the great things Dunya has going for it, you'd think you'd walk away spending a pretty penny, but the prices here are fantastic. Yet another reason why we can't stay away. Definitely give this place a look if you're in the neighborhood.

As a side note....the baklava is dangerously delicious. There's no sense in resisting it and you would regret missing out on it ;)
author: Tiffany H.

description:
With Casa Hookah gone, I knew this place would be better...and it was. Even though I am only (at this point) giving them two stars, the previous establishment was so awful I encourage people to stop in at Dunya and give it a go.

$12 bottomless mimosas are amazing...and when you bring along your friends who wouldn't want to spend the afternoon sipping champagne with a splash of OJ? Sadly, the mimosas here are very weak and pretty much just $12 Orange Juice. Further adding to the below average mimosas is that fact that they just come by the table and fill your glass up when they think it is ready. Needless to say, you may be waiting long enough to be drinking another Mimosas. 

The food can be good, but I have personally experienced some inconsistencies. I really like their hummos and pita bread. Their babajanoush was some of the worst I have had because of its flavorless tone and unauthentic texture and general peculiar texture. 

I would give Dunya another chance, but I think they need to get their Middle Eastern dishes down and they may need to hire another server to balance the work load.
author: Theresa T.

description:
Love Mediterranean food. Love wine bars. Needless to say I was particularly excited to try Dunya for dinner this weekend. While the overall impression seems positive it has gotten some mixed reviews- but after last night I'm surprised with some of the ratings on here. I had a fantastic time and will absolutely be back.

We had a great bottle of pinot noir and chose the duck and seafood risotto for entrees- everything was delicious. I'm all about sharing plates but other than exchanging 1 bite (don't get me wrong, the duck was great too) I cleaned my entire plate of risotto- apparently there's a reason it's listed on the menu as a chef favorite! Shrimp, scallops and cheesy goodness? Delightful. Good thing I had a run planned the next day because it was worth every bite.

Our waiter was hilarious and we got along with him really well- I feel like we really bonded and formed a friendship with this guy but of course forget his name so I'll just call him our waiter-friend. When our waiter-friend was off his shift he stopped by our table one last time to say bye. He was on his way to grab his bike and already wearing his helmet so joked about wanting to convert us- Mormon missionary style.

We realized too late that we were the last people there and they were waiting on us (oops) but the staff was so nice and even poured us each an additional glass of wine from one of their bottles behind the bar.

Can't wait to return for brunch (I'm a sucker for bottomless mimosas) or the weekday happy hour.
author: Brianna H.

description:
Another visit, and another awesome dinner.  Dunya is 2 for 2 with us, and we look forward to coming back a third time very soon.

On this visit, my wife and I brought along two of our visiting friends.  It was about 10:00 p.m. on a Friday night, and although the place was hopping, we were fortunate to grab one of the last four-person tables in the joint.  Thinking back to our last visit here, we immediately knew that we wanted the Falafel and the Hummus Plate for appetizers.  And as expected, both were just as good as they were the first time.

My wife and I shared the Free Range Chicken for dinner, which came with some seasoned vegetables and rice.  It was succulent - falling off the bone, not too greasy, and unbelievably simple but tasty at the same time.  Our friends tried the Sigara Boregi appetizer - a rich, fried feta cheese pasty - as well as one of the beef/lamb kebabs.  Both of our friends are from Armenian descent, so they're familiar with Mediterranean Cuisine and they were thoroughly impressed with what Dunya had to offer.

The icing on the cake was that one of the head servers dropped by our table to say hi.  He had served us on our first visit and recognized us.  He made sure we were well taken care of, and even returned with a second plate piled high with warm pita bread.  

This place is really very good.  Highly recommended!!
author: Tim N.

description:
4 Stars.

Another good eats discovered on Polk.  I had soup and salad with my friend, Robert, here yesterday for lunch.  The service was very friendly.  My ceasar salad was fine (nothing special but not bad) and the lentil soup was very good.
author: Kevin M.

description: When they first opened the food was amazing recently grabbed lunch there and it was sub par, wine selection is great but would prob pass on the food.
author: Ribec F.

description: We thought it was really delicious.  Got the Tzatziki sauce to start with follow by the chicken kabobs and the burger.  Chicken Kabobs were amazing and my companion was super jealous because his burger was good, but definitely not as good as mine!!
author: Alyse S.

description:
Do you LOVE flights of wine for $10 and cheap bites in wine bar atmosphere? If so, don't miss out on happy hour at Dunya. 

The lamb meatballs were TDF (to die for), as was the salmon, and the tuna sashimi. I loved all the wines included in the white flights (full glasses!). 

Be sure the make a reservation on opentable.com, or else you might be turned away.
author: Misha F.

description: I think this is a gem on Polk street. $10-$16 for an entree that's pretty damn good. Their daily fish special, lamb kabobs, and soups are my favorites. Food can take a bit long to come but they prepare everything fresh, so it's worth the wait.
author: S. P.

description: One of the best restaurants I've been to in SF. The staff is very friendly and professional. The food at Dunya is amazing. I'm a health nut and eating fresh is very important to me. After learning that all of their vegetables are organic and everything is basically hand picked by the chef and the owner this place became more enticing. I also drink wine. Another great thing about Dunya is that they're wine selection is better than a lot of the restaurants I've been to. I will strongly recommend my favorite wine at their restaurant, a red blend, called Caricature. Lastly, their dessert is something everyone must try. The baklava if my favorite. I've made this restaurant a regular place to visit. A tip would be to make a reservation since it is a popular place in the area.
author: Max M.

description:
Had their stuffed lamb meatballs and seafood risotto, both of which were absolutely wonderful!  Decent service; cozy setting.  You have a choice of either a traditional table or a communal bar for seating.  I'm not a drinker, so I can only tell you that their wine selection is HUGE, and that my friends were satisfied with their selection.

A bit pricey for everyday (at least for me), but definitely a must-try for anyone who plans to be nearby.
author: Brandon L.

description:
I stumbled upon this place because I found it on Groupon. I will go back. The food was delicious and the service was outstanding. 

Got milk? Had to have a glass with dessert and they were out, so the waiter actually left the restaurant to get some from elsewhere. 

The food didn't come out too fast , but the atmosphere is cozy so it didn't matter. The waiter brought out a couple rounds of tasty bread (warm from the oven) with olive oil and garlic-good stuff-while we waited. 

When the entrees arrived we were impressed. The food was very flavorful. The chef came over and chatted us up. Very impressive indeed.

   I highly recommend others to go dine at Dunya.
author: Alan S.

description: You get a lot for the money here.  The food is good to great but not knock your socks off good.  The ambiance is six stars. Eat here and you feel like you have eaten in SF. My wife and I eat here a couple of times a month and the hummus is much better than what you're used to. Friendly waitstaff with genuine smiles ( rare commodity). The kenafe desert is not to be missed.  We get out with $60 check including drinks and desert.  For 5 stars and $180 check, go to 1760 on the next block.  I think that unless you are a dotcom billionaire, you will be almost as happy here.  Polk street vibe is dicey, but not threatening.  We always send out of town visitors here as they feel they have eaten in real SF and yet the wallet is not in pain. I'm taking my vegetarian stepbrother here tonight and know we won't be disappointed
author: Peter S.

description:
Fresh, authentic, home-made style Mediterranean/Middle Eastern cuisine, superb and diversified wine list with many 'per glass' choices, with a cozy and informal atmosphere. Friendly and attentive service. What more can you ask for?
Answer: more fresh seafood selections...octopus would be nice!
author: Dr. B.

description:
I found out about the restaurant from Groupon.com. I had the impression that it was a Mediterranean establishment in the sense that I'd be able to order some baba ganoush or falafel but instead I had options like duck, lamb, and salmon.

I ordered the ceviche of the day which turned out to be far from what I expected. While it was possible to actually taste the fish, there was not a hint of lime, which in my opinion is a key ingredient to ceviche. Instead it was a sweeter melange of mango and perhaps orange juice. 

I ordered the sea scallops and my friend ordered the duck. The sea scallops were quite tasteful and well cooked but the pasta sauce tasted like expensive Chef Boyardee and the carrots were undercooked. The duck dish was an extremely small portion and my friend reported that it was overcooked. 

They did bring us delicious freshly baked bread a good 20 minutes after we had initially ordered. It was accompanied by olive oil over a delicious olive tapenade. 

Dunya is well described as a wine bar as it has a great selection of wines. I had the Sexto from Spain and my friend had the Sonoma Marrietta Petit Syrah. I would recommend both.

I was worried I'd be under dressed but the place turned out to be comfortable, casual, and classy.
author: Daniel G.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and was excited when I heard there was a new wine bar opening. What lured me in was their happy hour. I've been back a handful of times since then and just tried their dinner on Friday night with a girlfriend. Their happy hour specials are AMAZING! For $10 you get a glass of wine and an appetizer. I'm used to paying $10 just for a glass of wine so this was a treat! The portions are very generous. It's not a little glass of wine with a two-bite appetizer...you'll be satisfied with what you get...especially for ten bucks! 
 
On Wednesdays it's ladies night. If you buy one glass of wine, you get one free. They also have flight specials for $10 - I've tried both the red and white flights and they were fantastic. The owner was even nice enough to let me try the wines before ordering just to make sure I was happy. 

What I've tried for happy hour:
The grilled lamb riblettes are probably my favorite appetizer. Not only do you get the riblets but you get a nice salad to go with it. The lamb is tender and falls right off the bone. The ahi tartare and shrimp salad are also tasty. Each appetizer is paired with a complementing wine. 

What we had for dinner on Friday:
My girlfriend and I shared the mediterranean plate. Their hummus and baba ganoush are homemade and both are delicious. It comes with warm pita bread and a few other things. I ordered the grilled lamb chops for my entre. These were tender, juicy and cooked to perfection (medium rare the way I like it). I asked for no potatoes so he substituted them with spinach. I'd definitely get this dish again, but next time I'm trying the risotto. A few guys sitting next to us ordered it and it looked (and smelled) fantastic. My friend ordered the smoked salmon pancakes and the grilled lamb riblettes for her meal. I LOVE smoked salmon so I stole a few from her. They are yummy bits of heaven. 

I was surprised to read some of the comments regarding the staff. They've always been attentive and extremely friendly. This neighborhood spot will make you feel welcome and will treat you like family. 

If you don't live in the neighborhood it's worth the cab ride or drive over. There's a parking garage on Sacramento Street (between Polk and Van Ness) if you can't find street parking.

I'll definitely be back. They have the best happy hour in town (trust me when I say this because I've been to MANY hh's). The dinner was excellent and I can't wait to try their brunch with bottomless mimosas!
author: Heidi H.

description: As a Turk I can say that the food here is far from legitimate Turkish food and in general just had the wrong taste to it...I guess the ambiance is nice but don't plan on eating here.
author: Yas E.

description: Great food and very solid dinner food. Fantastic wine selection and good deal in wine flight. Get the hummus it is very fresh.
author: Jason M.

description:
Went here with a group of friends for a nice dinner out. The place is awesome, the service is friendly, they just need to get their menus/cooking a bit straightened out.

We ordered two bottles of wines for a group of 6 and they were both fine. No issues with the drinks at all.

But food wise we all ordered various things:

Appetizers:
Stuffed Green Olives with Lambs - A couple of my friends got this, I didn't try it but the main fact is that when the dishes came, there were no olives on the plate. Instead it was a plate of salad with 4 lamb meatballs. We asked our server who then confirmed that we were correct, there were no olives so they just had the lamb meatballs tonight. My friends said they were fine to eat, but just in principle they surely didn't get what they had ordered/expected to eat.

Crispy Ahi Tuna Tartare - Again some of the other people in our group got this for their appetizer. Let's just say it wasn't really ahi tuna, but more fully-cooked tuna eggrolls. Again, they were fine but not what was expected and definitely not ahi tuna

Smoked Salmon and Grits Pancake - This actually came out the way it was expected. I had a bite of my friend's and it was alright. Not absolutely amazing but the grit pancake had a nice texture to them. The salmon was nothing our of the ordinary and the crab was a nice touch.

Capay Farms Organic Greens - With my love of beets, I got this salad but was sad to find only 2-3 small pieces of beets when my salad came out. As a one out of three of the ingredients listed, I was hoping for much more but was sad to find a measly few.

Entree:
Grilled Pomegranate BBQ Kobe Sirloin: I think 3/6 of my friends got this dish and was not very impressed with it. For me, it was very odd to find that two of them seem to have gotten 'filet mignon' cuts and then the third got a VERY marbled piece of sirloin (more so like ribeye even) cut. They all said the sauce was a bit overpowering, I had a taste of the meat. It was ok. My friend definitely had hers requested at a Medium and receive it more so on the rare side. Again, another friend had tons of fat on his making it less like a sirloin.

Pan Roasted Fresh Scallops: I got this dish, which ended up being more of a pasta dish. There were maybe 3-4 small pieces of scallops and even then, when I was chewing them, I definitely felt some pieces of sand or something that made crunchy noises. In addition, the dish wasn't very hot which made me think it had been sitting there for a bit and thus was not fresh. I didn't even finish the dish, I got a bit turned off 1/4 through it.

Grilled Romesco Muscovy Duck: This was a pretty good dish, I think from what my friend had said after eating it. She did say though that it was dressed a bit too much with the sauce and it was overpowering for duck.

Dessert:
It was a friend's birthday, so we asked to have a mini celebration for her. They came out with a cheesecake, which even between the 6 of us was NOT finished. And this cheesecake was NOT that big (maybe 4" in diameter?). The cheese did not taste like it was made with the correct type of cheese. A bit too intense for cheesecake.

Overall, the food was a bit of a downer. However, service was absolutely amazing. She was sweet enough to give us the cheesecake and a small bottle of bubbly because we were celebrating our friend's birthday. 

I think I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and say it was an off night for them especially since all the other reviews are full 5 stars! Give them some time since they just opened up and return back in a few months and hope for better. All in all we had a grand time, but the food wasn't what we expected nor did it blow us away.
author: Jung-Ah Y.

description:
So glad to have an upscale restaurant in my section of Polk Street. This is the mid rent district sandwiched between Lower Nob Hill and Russian Hill.

I went here last weekend before the final episode of "Breaking Bad." We were in a bit of a rush, so I was constrained to order only one dish.

I had the pan roasted fresh scallops. It consisted of scallops, fettuccine, organic mixed vegetables in a fresh tomato sauce. It was delicious.

I'll have to come back and try their lunch menu.
author: Robert C.

description:
I'm not sure why this place wasnt packed.... the app platter was excellent - specifically, the hummus, dolmas and yogurt dip were my favorites and the soup special of the day "Carrot/Squash" was delicious! 

Cute little hidden gem on Polk.
author: Jodie B.

description: More expensive than advertised. Food prices are creeping up in SF and Dunya has not updated their pricing here on Yelp. The lamb burger is now $14.00 and the Adana Kebab is now $16.00, so with tax, that's very lean meal for two, costing $33.00 before tip.
author: Michael S.

description:
First of all, this place is not Mediterranean. I'm Greek and have been around Mediterranean food for most of my life, so I feel I can safely say that.  None of their entrés were Mediterranean, and I certainly wouldn't classify a restaurant as being Mediterranean just because they have hummus as an appetizer.  It was a bit disappointing to walk in, sit down, and read the menu.  I would say Dunya is more Asian/Italian/American fusion.  

That being said, the food was still very good.  I had salmon with rice and mango salsa, and my boyfriend had some kind of roasted chicken dish.  My food was decent although the mango salsa was too sweet, if there were any kind of spices at all in the salsa, or even just a little coriander mixed in, that would have improved the dish quite a bit.  Also, the salmon itself seemed very bland, usually salmon has quite a powerful flavor so I was put off by that.  And if I'm going to be really picky, it was a little on the dry side as well.  My boyfriend's food however seemed great.  He was very satisfied with the taste, and from what I could tell the chicken looked very moist.  The portion he had was huge, it was practically a whole chicken!  And it was almost entirely meat, he only found one bone. 

The best part about Dunya is the service, our waitress was extremely attentive, she checked in on us enough times without overdoing it, and she was prompt with the check.
author: S. F.

description:
wow yelp strikes again.  

i mean, ok the food didn't make me sick, i'll give you that.  but there is no flavor at all, and the veggies are overcooked.  we ordered the mixed grill, so we tried a variety of offerings, and it was a total fail.  

there are too many other mediterranean/middle eastern restaurants that have set the bar in a way that exposes Dunya's shortcomings.  my dinner was bad enough that i cut my losses and stopped short, and went out for a pizza to fill me up.  

there is a Yelp photo for this restaurant that reads "sad, sad takeout"-- my girlfriend and i thought "c'mon isn't that harsh?" but what we found out is that pretty much sums up the Dunya experience.
author: eshwar k.

description: Good food, nice service, good ambiance, fast service. Try their musaka. They expect a big surprise though.
author: Sasan A.

description: I went to Dunya for the first time last week and was very, very impressed. First, the food was so amazing! From the appetizers to the main course to the desserts! It was super delicious!! Loved the menu and the portions were right on! They have a great wine list and I chose a tempranillo and it was super yummy!! The service was impeccabile! We had the best waiter, he was from Spain... what a great accent! Can't wait to come back!! thx Dunya!
author: Josh G.

description:
When the Boy and I were in a hurry to make it to a guided tour of the Haas-Lilienthal House down the street we stopped into this aromatic, little joint at around 1:30pm on a beautiful, warm and sunny Sunday.
The decor was hip and chic and the scents and sights of food drew us in like the cartoons-by our noses. 
We were seated quickly and the wait staff were friendly and attentive.
The menu offered so many delicious Greek/Italian fusion choices that we had a tough time deciding but we were in a time crunch so I ordered the Prosciutto Benedict and The Boy got a lamb burger.
Our food came very quickly and we always share so we swapped bites of savory, juicy lamb burger with a crusty bun and generously doused (and perfectly cooked and seasoned) garlic fries and perfectly done and salty prosciutto benedict with a tender English muffin soaking up the sauces. We were in heaven. The portions were perfect and our tummies were happily full as we got our timely check and made our way to the tour. We both would definitely go here again. 
Delish!
author: Cicily J.

description:
OMG this place was great! We ordered the appetizers platter which was a mish mash of everything, and the kebab platter wow! I wish I didn't pig out so much on the yogurt and hummus so I could have eaten more of the meat! 
Really happy my good friend lives a block away we plan on going back for sure! We also got an extra glass of wine each even after we paid, just because....can't say no to that!
author: Jennifer T.

description: I've been to Dunya a few times and plan on coming back.  Good place to bring a group because of their variety of menu items,  you can even keep vegetarians happy! fair prices for big portion sizes and a yummy wine selection.
author: Maddy F.

description:
I have been here once before but it has been awhile.  Since my date has been to Dunya many times, I was excited to get his recommendations on what to order. We came last Saturday night. We arrived somewhat early after a day walking our dogs at Alamo Square.   
We started off with red wine... a delicious blend of Zin & Cab... I can't recall the winery. We shared the appetizer platter, which had a little of everything. I love hummus & falafel. We continued to drink, he probably should have ordered a bottle. And later we shared the Beyti, which was absolutely incredible. I've never had anything like it.  It has lamb, walnuts  and yummy other stuff wrapped and cut up in slices with tomatoe sauce and yogurt drizzled through out.  We just ate, drank, talked and laughed... I think our waiters probably wanted us to leave since the table next to us, had rotated 3 different couples while we were there.  Customer service is very accommodating & super friendly.  I'm guessing he tips well. 
I love that this is walking distance from where I live.  I look forward to coming back.
author: Myra M.

description: I have to say this was disappointing.  The waiter was really great, I really liked him.  It was the food and the prices though that got me.  I had the prosciutto panini and a glass of wine.  Prosciutto is not ham.  That was a grilled ham and cheese sandwich.  The french fries were good.  The salad greens were not fresh.   After tip I paid $25 for a grilled ham and cheese sandwich and a glass of wine.  If there was a happy hour here, I was not made aware of it.  The place has a nice ambiance and I'm guessing that the rest of the food on the menu might be really good based on other reviews, I think I just didn't make a good choice.  So I will come back and update my review then.
author: Chris W.

description:
I would love to return here for lunch and get one of their grilled chicken sandwiches. I was a little disappointed those weren't served at dinner.
I did enjoy my shepherd's salad with grilled chicken. My boyfriend got a meat dish wrapped in lavash and was disappointed that his entree didn't come with rice like the other entrees. When he asked the waiter about his missing rice, the waiter brought him some gratis. I thought that was a warm gesture.
author: Eva UnTiger S.

description:
I wouldn't give this a one star. 
1) Walked in the front door and was not acknowledged by any of the staff.
2) Stood there for about 2 minutes until finally getting service.
3) Sat outside the waitress stepped on my shoes, and was insincere with her apology.
4) Waited almost 20 minutes for 1 appetizer and 1 entree in an EMPTY restaurant with no other dining customers.
5) Never followed up with our opinion of the food.
Overall bad service, bad food, don't waste your time or money!

RATING: GARBAGE!
author: Jammy J.

description:
Opens for dinner and I'm glad they're also serving lunch as well now.  You can tell the chef really cares about food as everything seems to be done with care.  Flavor's robust and just right.  Ingredient's fresh.

They have a really nice wine selection too.
author: Winnie C.

description: Came here with my girlfriend for brunch on Sunday and my experience was awesome. What a better way to start your day than bottomless mimosas and some quality food. Everybody was really nice, helpful and every question we had was answered professionally and with a smile. I can't stop thinking about their baklava since we left. It was amazing. Definitely a must.
author: Trayan P.

description:
Delicious appetizers and wine.  

Friendly bartender.  

But, is there still a happy hour?  Got there at 645 and the bartender told us no happy hour.  Lame (-1 star) or else pretty good.  

Also, they totally changed the ambiance, I wouldn't have met a guy friend at such an intimate looking place.
author: F K.

description:
Great affordable wine list.  Great food.  Great service.  Great atmosphere and they don't have a freezer or a microwave so you know the food isn't full of free radicals and carcinogens.

Definitely a good spot for a date because the music isn't blaring and you can actually hear what people sitting across the table are saying!
author: Phil S.

description:
Wandering around Polk St on a Sunday and realized..it's Brunch time. Stopped in here and it was not bad. 

-Coffee (not my style)
-Veggie omelette (good) 
-Salsa (too many chili flakes and it was more of a paste)
-French toast (pretty good)

Service was nice and attentive so always a plus for that
author: Lola D.

description:
My friends and I visited this restaurant with high hopes as it had pretty good reviews on yelp. We ordered hummus to start and each had our own entrees. 

Hummus ($6) was bland but creamy-I love hummus so I ate it, anyway. Overall, it was a forgettable dish.
Chicken Shish Kebab ($12)- my kebab was not fully cooked. When I told my waiter in a discrete and polite way to not scare neighboring tables, he simply glanced at it and walked away. Perhaps he was too ashamed to apologize? Who knows. He did come back to tell me two more minutes but did not acknowledge the pinky texture of my meat. 
It came back with the missing chunk that was pink, super greasy, yet still not flavorful. Hmmmm if I'm going to eat something so oily, I'd expect some delicious goodness at the least but this was far off.  I wish this tasted better since it looked so good on the plate. My order also came with a side of grilled/greasy veggies- I DID like the veggies though- they were extremely flavorful. 
Sparkling Rose ($36/bottle)- We opted for this since not everyone in our party likes reds. Nothing spectacular- I'd recommend not ordering this either.

We opted to not risk it with dessert since the dishes were all mediocre. Overall, the restaurant has a nice decor and homey vibe. I just wish my chicken was fully-cooked and more tasty. Overall, 2.5/5 stars but I'll round up since their bar area did look appealing.
author: Patricia K.

description: I finally tried Dunya again, but this time for dinner. It was fantastic! Had the Adana kebab and then the kunefe for dessert. Both were delicious. While the chef was really friendly and came to our table to greet us, the wait staff wasn't quite as attentive or hospitable. Nevertheless, I will definitely come back to this great neighborhood gem!
author: Buster B.

description:
Don't bother...

parking sucks
food takes forever
food is overpriced
food is undersized

and if you still don't believe me.. look at the reviews below... 

We had the duck (very small portion), scallops and fettuccine (bigger portion.. but noodles were under cooked, and they were stuck together), my friend had the ahi tuna which looked like cooked tuna eggrolls.. and some salad.. we all agreed.. not ever coming here again... 

If they want to stay in business. They better higher more cooks, have a better menu.. and cook better... 

wish I could say something positive.. oh.. they were kind enough to refill our bread basket 3x (2 because we were starving while waiting for our food that took like an hour..and 1 more time.. after we saw how much food they gave us) O_o
author: Kristina L.

description:
Going downhill so soon? One month ago this would have been five stars. 

The food is always, as others have mentioned, spot on. This has become my new Sunday brunch spot, with the bottomless mimosas being a huge plus. I've had five different selections off the brunch menu and none have disappointed. 

However, the last few weeks have seen a change in staffing that's changing my opinion. When the busboy is paying more attention to you than the two servers, there is a problem. This Sunday and last, the server responsible for the bar patrons seems mostly annoyed that he Is there, much less having to take orders, carry plates the four feet from the kitchen pick-up to the bar, and god forbid, fill an empty mimosa flute. 

Additionally, it seems that they've lost the third server on Sundays. The food is taking much longer, and if you'd like your check in 5 minutes, you should give him an additional 10 minute lead time. 

Please bring back the charming server who manned the Sunday brunch bar in early July. Having to rely on the polite, but very busy, busboy for mimosa refills is getting tiresome.

Dunya, you're getting copycats on the bottomless mimosa brunch draw. It's time to renew the fantastic server staff that had us enamored when you first opened. We want to see you succeed, but there are plenty of other options on Polkstrasse.
author: erika h.

description: I am such a fan of this place.  The Mezze platter is as good as it gets with combo appetizers but the lamb meatballs...WOW.  They are incredible.  The falafel salad has fresh avocado salsa on it which makes it incredible and the borek is always piping hot and amazing.  I have picked up from this place and sat down at the restaurant bar for dinner and have had nothing but amazing food and service.  Highly recommend!
author: Nicki T.

description:
This is a really cute place. It's small but they were able to seat a large party of eight on a Friday night at about 6:30pm without a reservation. The wine was good and the food was decent. 

The Staff was friendly but beware this place no longer accepts http://Restaurant.com certificates. Thankfully our waiter was kind enough to honor it, but I'm not sure if they will continue to do that because there was some slight resistance.
author: elizabeth r.

description: Great kabob and other Mediterranean delicacies. Can't believe I waited so long to try it.
author: Joe S.

description:
This place no longer accepts Restaurant.com certificates!  Our waiter was kind enough to honor it, but future users beware!  

The hummus was tasty and the pita bread was a pillow of deliciousness.  The falafel, on the other hand, was terrible and completely lacking in flavor.
author: Sona P.

description:
This review is for breakfast / brunch.  

Looking for a non-divey, Polk Street breakfast spot I tried Dunya today.  Out of our party of four, none of us were impressed with the experience BUT I do think there's potential.

Things done well:  The ambiance is quite nice.  Lightly-glossed, wood paneled walls make you feel as though the place has been there for ever, the lighting & simple decor were pleasant and the bar was lovely.  The staff were friendly but...

...Considering there was only one party in the restaurant when we got there, the service was questionable (which I'm chalking up to the staff being green).  I was the only person who asked for a drink (diet coke with a lemon) and I had to ask again for the lemon when it came.  At a busy bar I get forgetting the garnish but when you are the ONLY customer placing a drink order - I don't get it.

The pancakes were voted "pretty good" but the eggs benedict received an "I make a better eggs benny at home" and the hash was, and this was a  first - mushy.  I must say the flavor was good but I just didn't appreciate the consistency being something like raw ground chuck.  I had to request toast (which didn't come with the hash) to smear it on.  The toast took at least 10 minutes and while the waitress was sweet & apologized for the wait - any breakfast spot (with only 8 customers on hand) should be able to quickly produce toast.  Worth noting is that we also had to request: salt, pepper, Tabasco and silverware.

All in all, I'm not opposed to trying Dunya again.  I'm hoping that breakfast is a new offering for them and they just need some time to figure it out and get the operation running more smoothly.


"
author: MJ P.

description:
we came there about 2pm and it was a pretty quiet wine bar with only one other couple there.  We took a seat at the front of the restaurant as I wanted to see how cute thiis place was...and it was cute :)
2pm and the menu was pretty limited to breakfast itmes and brunch items.  I was not content at first but then looked again and found steak and eggs and scallop risotto.  i can work with those items.  we had a $30 groupon to use and didnt want to spend too much as we had dinner in a few hrs.
as for drinks, $5 for a mimosa or $12 for endless mimosa...hmmm, endless it is :)
the steak and eggs were OK.
the scallops risotto was perfect.  the prawns made it more magnificiant as it was not part of the menu item but the chef added it in there for us.  i'll take it!
as there were not a lot of ppl, we were able to talk to one of the partners.  very nice conversation with great food.  I cannot expect more :)
author: Ann N.

description: I stumbled upon this cute little place while waiting for my dog's grooming in Nob Hill. Very impressive wine list! I found out they have only been opened less than two years. The wait staff is very friendly as I sat myself at the bar counter by my lonesome. Bar guy is super nice and allowed me to sip a variety of international wine. I settled on something from South Africa and ordered their falafel appetizer. It was like crack and why the 5 stars. Goat cheese stuffed inside! It was a guilty pleasure blend of warm crispiness on the outside - not too salty - with gooey deliciousness on the inside that melted like heaven at the same time I was flashing my devilish stare. I broke up with my uncommitted raw diet relationship that day.
author: Deborah V.

description:
Having lived and studied cooking in Istanbul for 4 years, I'm pretty picky when it comes to Turkish/Mediterranean food. But Coskun does a pretty good job of recreating an authentic meal at Dunya!

We had both vegetarian as well as meat dishes - everything was spot on with a subtle Californian twist. Save room for dessert as the kunefe was perfect.

As delicious as the food is, unfortunately, the waiters here kind of suck. I'm not sure if it's because they might not know English that well, but they are some of the unfriendliest bunch I've come across and don't do much to earn tips, not even smile.

Definitely go, but go only for the food and enjoy!
author: sar h.

description: This place is great to have a chill yummy dinner. It's not too expensive, well lit, intimate without being too romantic. The food is good and I especially like all the dips. They have a great wine list as well.
author: Kim M.

description: This place gets over looked way too much. the space is small and great for a romantic dinner or a casual lunch with a buddy where you don't need to talk over all the crazy noise. It's food is delicious, the service is fast and they have a decent wine selection.
author: Krystle L.

description:
I have been on Polk street since the mid 70s and never found a place that I frequented as much.

DUNYA WINE BAR is a great addition to Polk Street.  It is has a comfortable feeling, minimalist, dark interior that is extremely soothing.

It is not loaded with derelicts, queens, punks or  fools.  The crowd is quite nice, diverse in always~ ALL IN ALL, A GREAT MIX.

Something drew me during THE MIDDLE OF THE DAY.  It was appealing and I had an incredible butternut squash soup with roasted duck, I'D LOVE TO HAVE IT AGAIN.  The soup was stellarand the other soups are always a cut above.

The Happy Hour Special is $10.00 for a paired wine and appie.  The appies are really well done, I just wish the "Tartare of ahi was diced instead of mushy.  The duck appie is a duck ball with olive in the center and very delicious.  The salad with prawns is worth it every penny, very fresh, large and delicious.

I have been there multiple times and enjoyed the staff from the bar, wait staff, chef  and gopher, THE FOOD and WINE.

A GF and I went Saturday nite and enjoyed the meal that was appies, soup and wine.

I'll be back.
author: ELINOR H.

description:
Went here about a month ago and have been meaning to review it since then.  Delicious food.  Took my Fiance as it's nearby where we live and couldn't have been happier!  

I had the Adana Kebab which was delicious.  She's a vegetarian and we will definitely be back as she has a ton of options to choose from.

The wine selection is also great and very reasonably priced.  The owners and staff were helpful and friendly.  We will be back and maybe found our new neighborhoold go to restaurant!
author: Troy C.

description: We loved the food, service, and atmosphere here. It's a tiny place, but cute. We were able to walk in with 5 on a Sat night, but then the tables were full. The staff was very friendly and attentive, and the food was good. We had a selection of appetizers dolma, falafel (loved), hummus and eggplant. The chicken kabobs were our favorites, but lamb and others were good too. We enjoyed the wines, but the selection of bottles was more extensive than by the glass. Flights are available at the bar only.
author: N C.

description: I liked the ambiance,  service and of course food 3 in 1 amazing. I really liked chicken pataluma and my friends had lamb kebab I got a bit it was really delicious and flavor was good too. Our server was nice too as I remember his name was Youksel. I did thank to chief in person. I'll definitely go back there again. Highly recommended.
author: Danny M.

description:
The place is not huge but staff are really friendly. Ambience is nice for a date night as music is at the right volume so it doesn't drown out conversations but doesn't make for awkward silences. 

Food:
Lamb meatballs - lamb meat is very well cooked. The meatballs are stuffed with chopped olives and gives it a really nice Mediterranean flavor. The side salad with feta that came with it looked more like an afterthought and was a little unnecessary.
Shredded pork fettuccine ragu - meh. The pasta was tasteless, not even salty enough to make for a good pasta. Pasta tasted like it was pre-cooked and cooled down so it doesn't hold on to the tomato sauce so it just tastes like plain pasta with a side of shredded pork in tomato sauce. The pork was alright too. This is their special so it's not on the regular menu.
Seafood rissotto - It was pretty good. The seafood (2 shrimp, 2 scallops) were pretty well cooked and decent. It tasted fresh. The rice was good. The whole dish was pretty good. $20 good? No.

The wait staff was really nice and upbeat. However, when someone asks me how the food is, I mean to tell the truth. I said it was good, but I was suprised by the extra small portion of my fettuccine dish, especially compared to the man next to me that got the exact same thing and was obviously a way larger portion. She goes "oh...okay." and walks away. Mmm...ok...

We had a groupon so overall it was a just alright experience. Our bill before groupon was around $45. I think without the groupon my feelings about the place would have been a little lower.
author: Carol L.

description:
Went here with a friend to check it out.  We had a Restaurant.com coupon to use there.  The good news is that the coupon also covers the wine purchases, but the bad news is that the food was meh and the service was spotty.  I'm not coming back here anytime soon, that's for sure.

When we first walked in, the waitress was very confused as to whether we stand and wait for a seat, how long it would take, or if we should sit at the bar.  When I asked for info, it was pretty much I don't know.  She's not rude about it, just not knowledgeable.  Finally we wrangled some seats at the bar to be close to the service and wines, and also saw the waitress end some other customers over to the bartender to get seated.  Of course, the bartender looks back at the customers that just asked him about seating and said he didn't know.  Those customers were frustrated too.  Not surprising.  

Bottom line is, food is mediocre, service was spotty.  With all these restaurants in SF, this one is not deserving of your attention.
author: Leo C.

description: Cool little spot. Excellent food, but small menu. Not many tables, ambiance is nice. Really good after work or happy hour spot.
author: Robert A.

description: Bottomless mimosas? yes! Yummy food and huge portions? Yes!!! Good ambience? YES YES YES! Overall this place is awesome. The service can be a tiny bit slow at times but I suggest relaxing, sitting back and sippin on your awesome mimosa to take the edge off.
author: Bella S.

description: great food and great service. Very friendly staff. The food was all fresh and the meat was good quality. Dying to return for their mimosa brunch!
author: Karishma K.

description: Awesome ambiance, excellent service and good food! I had the beyti which was good, the yogurt and tomato sauce was good and the lamb was tender. They give you fresh pita bread upon request and it was warm and yummy! It's a nice little spot and they have a good wine menu that is decently priced. Will be going back very soon!
author: Jennifer J.

description:
My husband and I stopped in here the other day for some lunch.  I was thoroughly impressed with the prices, fresh and creative food and mostly the taste of everything we ate.  

I believe they change their menu daily depending on what the chef picks up from the farmers market that day.  We had the arugula tuna salad to start and the kobe sliders.  Definitely recommend both these dishes.  I only wish we had room for the homemade berry cobbler from scratch!  Can't wait to come back here for dinner.
author: Britt B.

description:
I ate here late last year and forgot about it until now, as I was searching for a new Mediterranean place to try. It was overpriced for the size of the portions, but the food was ok.

The falafels were good - crispy and good tasting. The lamb gyro was great - the lamb itself was very succulent and aromatic, and the rest of it was decent enough, I can't really remember anything besides the lamb. My friend got the chicken gyro, which he said was good but not astounding.

The service was good, the waitress made a mistake on my friend's order but took it back and brought the right dish a while later. The seating was very tight and a little uncomfortable IMO. The ambiance is nice, definitely the type of place to go out for a nice dinner, not grab lunch with buddies.

The lamb gyro was awesome, I want to go back, but it emptied my wallet more than it filled my stomach.
author: I Stepped On J.

description: The most underrated breakfast spot in the area. Get the Corned Beef Hash, so, so good. Always lines at Toast, but this place rarely has lines, has a great range of breakfast and lunch opens and $12 bottomless mimosa Saturday and Sunday 10am - 3pm.
author: Brad N.

description:
I wanted to try Dunya for a long time, but never went in because it looked a little too pretentious for a casual drink or bite to eat.  Wow was I wrong!  I finally tried it a couple months ago and now I am hooked.  In addition to being close to my house, I also love the food, wine, ambience, and most of all the staff!  They could not make me and my friends more comfortable when ever we're there.  They remember what we like, offer suggestions and even sneak in a free appetizer for us from time to time...  :)

As far as the food, I highly recommend the Appetizer Taster, Falafel Salad and the Lamb Meatball Sub- amazing!  It's Mediterranean/Turkish food at it's best.  Accompany your dish of choice with a fine wine and you've the perfect meal!  The best part is, you can leave spending under 20 bucks, easy. 

The last thing I will mention is bottomless mimosas and their breakfast menu.  Bring a friend on a sunny day,  grab a table outside and you've got a perfect afternoon!
author: Kathryn G.

description: sweet setup and friendly staff. I ordered small plates and they were flavorful and delicious! As a foodie I dont think you can go wrong with Turkish food :)
author: Yas G.

description: What a fun place with great shish-ke-babs.  Went there early and had the place to ourselves.  A neighborhood gem with good food.
author: Rich L.

description: Got Feta Prawns, they were deeeelish. When I was done with them, I couldn't stop soaking pita bread in the sauce
author: Kathryn M.

description: Perfect place for an intimate diner with the wife. They have a great wine selection. The service was spot on. And the food was amazing. We order the lamb meatballs and they each had a kalamata olive in the center - I am going to try that at home. It added such a new dimention to a simple meatball. I also had the Lamb Shish Kebab and it was great.  - We finished it off with a cheeze plate and even the cheeses were really well selected.
author: Mario N.

description: I tried this place yesterday and I really like it. Good food and good appetizers with an authentic environment.
author: Alper K.

description: Everything we ordered was delicious and the service was great.  We had the Muhammara, Prawns Shish Kabab, Falafel, and Mango Panna Cotta- all stellar, and the bill was very reasonable!
author: Liz Y.

description:
The food was amazing, such a true taste of what Mediterranean cuisine should be. They have a nice open kitchen so you can see the cook and smell the flavors. I can't even explain what I had.
