There was lamb, hummus, olives, chick & steak skewers. So much food for the four of us and it costs nothing. And it was so good. I already have plans to return next Thursday. 

They have a great wine bar as well, so there were people just hanging out having wine and appetizers. Which I will be doing more regularly. 

I recommend it to everyone. And try the baklava for dessert. The cook gave us complementary pieces and it was amazing.
author: Patrick O.

description: The best Mediterranean food that is soo close to home!!! Tender quality Lamb and Beef dishes. Adana Kabab is my fav with a glass of bubbly.
author: Ethel R.

description: Food is great. Brunch is a must with bottomless mimosas. Great selections for dinner and wines as well. A definite favorite.
author: Dylan M.

description: Fabulous food, great wine and beer selection and beautiful ambience! Only caveat is that service can be slightly slow...their staffing may not have caught up with their popularity. Solid Mediterranean staples, and a very creative brunch menu. Happy hour is a fantastic deal too, with generous hours that overlap with dinner.
author: Danielle R.

description: Let me just start off by saying thank you for placing a precious gem in the heart of San Francisco.  Dunya, is by far, hands down, one the best restaurants in San Francisco.  Dishes are made using a unique combination of delicate flavors balanced with what just has to be the freshest ingredients used.  You can not go wrong with one dish on the menu. Enjoy your experience because it will be memorable.
author: Michelle S.

description: Been here about 3-4 times now and love this place. Their Lamb Burger is RIDICULOUS! so good!!.  Had brunch here a couple of times too and enjoyed the food.  Also I must say the service here is really good, the staff are awesome and will go the extra mile to make you feel comfortable. Will def go back here again!
author: hanzal M.

description:
Seriously, this place sucks.  We came in today (Memorial Day) around 1:50pm.  Got seated, no problem.  Put in our order at 2pm.  Noticed that they started turning people away and then saw the sign outside that they would be closing at 3pm today for the holiday.  At 2:20pm, our drinks still had not arrived.  I flagged down the waiter to ask if we could get our drinks (diet coke.... seriously so difficult?) at which point he tells us "The kitchen is having problems.  No more food."  "What do you mean no more food?".  "We want to close by 3pm" he mumbles.
"What???  You waited half an hour after we get here to tell us you are not going to serve us because you want to get out by 3pm?"
"Yeah, sorry."
What???? Never again!!
author: Danielle S.

description: Great food and ambiance. A nice selection of choices for all tastes. Try the appetizer platter for a sampling, the eggplant was amazing. My wife's trout, a special, was especially good.  Nice wine list and very friendly service, casual but professional.
author: John W.

description:
Just enjoyed lunch #2 at this place, and again thoroughly impressed.

With a creative energy, Dunya's chef has served us masterful presentations for bargain prices.

Visit #1
Tuna tar-tar and kobe beef sliders split for 2, $8 per person.  The kobe sliders were served without ketchup.  What's a restaurant to do when using only fresh and local products? They MADE THEIR OWN KETCHUP upon request.

Visit #2
Tuna tar-tar and seared scallop sliders split for 2, $8 per person

We typically look for lighter fare or sandwiches during lunch and Dunya has managed to perfectly hit the spot on two occasions thus far.  We've enjoyed 4 star restaurant meals with friendly and equally bright service, all for about $10 per person.  With a menu that changes daily made from local fresh ingredients, I think I've finally found a place to become one of the regulars.
author: Joe B.

description: Best lamb burger ever! Charming space with a large selection of wine. Has a neighborhood feel with reasonable prices. My friend had the chicken pesto sandwich and also was very happy with his meal. Both were on ciabatta buns with a small Salad and fries. Definitely will be back!
author: Todd S.

description: It is good and rather reasonable, specially if you stay to the appetizer menu. The have a good selection of food and wines. The place is small, uncomfortable and kinda noisy. It looks like a great stop on a bar hopping night.
author: Natasha M.

description: We stumbled upon this place when we went to "that"side of Polk for some dancing.  It took us quite a while to get seated but the staff was aware of us waiting and kept us  posted on the table ditch.  There were a few glitches but all in all the service was good and the food was really good.  My only complaint is that the plates are too big for the size of the tables.
author: Kirsten M.

description: We stumbled on this place and were totally happy with the results.  Server thought he couldn't seat us as he was waiting on a party of 10 but then called to us half way down the block.  Lentil soup, calamari with tomatoes and olives, chicken kabobs, all delicious.  It was hopping and had a good vibe.  Enjoy!
author: M M.

description: Great place! Good food, good service! I had the kofte kebab (minus the rice + extra veggies, no problem). Nicely cooked veggies, the kebab was perfectly cooked and great seasoning trough out the whole dish.
author: Agnes N.

description: Just got a bottle of wine and a selection of apps and was pleased with everything! Food was tasty, wine was delicious (got a bottle of the zin-cab blend, which seemed popular that night). The place was full but not too crowded, so it was comfortable. I'll be back to try out their brunch! $12 bottomless mimosas!!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Great food! Greek salad and chicken kabob are fabulous. Would go back at least weekly if I lived in San Francisco. Highly recommend!!
author: Lisa S.

description:
I tried this place a while back and really wanted to like it but was underwhelmed. I decided to give it another shot today.

FIRST of all - service and other issues:
1. I went in and there are like 6 people who work there all just kinda standing around watching me. It makes me feel like I'm intruding in someone's home. They are all extremely friendly and eager to help, it's just a little odd.
2. The happy hour special says that wine is half price 4-7. I ordered 2 glasses of wine and was charged full price. Nobody told me about any special. I found out only when I went to write this review. NOT COOL.
3. The menu says all entrees are served with rice and vegetables. Apparently all except for the one I chose. When I brought this up, the manager/owner pointed to my plate and showed me some vegetables on it. When I pointed out that was not what I had expected, he brought me some wonderful roasted veggies and rice.
4. I ordered some stuff to go after my meal.They sent me home with the sauce already on the salad and such and seeping everywhere. NOT COOL.

SECOND - the food:
1. Dolmas are one of my favorite things in the world. These were tasty, but super mushy inside, which was kinda gross.
2. The beyti was good, but the meat was a little dry. It was also cold when it came to me even though I was one of 2 tables at the time.
3. The wine list is really pretty darn good.
4. The falafel is some of the best I've had.
5. The meatballs were supposed to come with romesco sauce and didn't. They were dry and hard.
6. The hummus is pretty good, but they sent it with me in an overfilled foldover container so it spilled everywhere. They wrapped the pita in a roll, which was covered in the sauce they put on the salad. 

The wine list is redeeming. The location and the outdoor table are great. But I won't be back for food and will expect them to mess up everything if I decide to brave it for the wine.
author: Monika M.

description: Excellent Mediterranean food. Kebabs and other meat is succulent and of fine quality. Oddly, they serve an American type brunch, an it's great. Sometimes service can be slow, but it's always laud back and friendly. One of the best restaurants on Polk and pricing is ok.
author: Ichor B.

description:
I stumbled upon Dunya on my way back from the hardware store a few moments ago. The restaurant's warm, lush, elegant, parlor inspired decor and original artwork invited me in. My brunch order of a neatly layered ensemble of potato pancakes, smoked salmon, and poached eggs was a divinely balanced and flavorful offering. I believe this special premiered today, and I must say that it has earned my endorsement.

That the waiter was out of commission due to a car accident this morning and the owner had to make a run to the shop next door to fetch some coffee on my behalf only served to enhance and render more intriguing my dining experience.

I think some Yelp reviewers shortchange themselves when they expect perfection, as conventionally defined, in their dining experiences. For me, it is the little surprises, such as the owner's charming inexperience assuming the waiter's role due to his unexpected absence, that make dining experiences particularly delectable and worth savoring. I hope San Francisco is kind (and smart) enough to give this place another chance to tease and stimulate her palette. I will be back for ladies' happy hour in a few weeks.
author: Silke S.

description: I don't end up in this neighborhood a lot but I think I found a gem of a restaurant!  I had hummus and lentil soup and they were both very good.  The service was good as well; attentive without being overbearing.  I'd definitely go back.
author: Eileen L.

description: Great food, cute place.. Our turkish server was very friendly and kind. Loved everything especially kunefe!!! Definitely recommended..
author: Melissa L.

description: I went back despite my previous experience. I enjoyed a nice appetizer of hummus and pita bread followed by  prawns for dinner. My wine was OK but honestly, I'm still not a raving fan of this place. I do like the atmosphere but I find the waiters to be a bit aloof. My water glass went empty for quite a while and my waiter lacked personality. I like servers who have pizazz and are excited to discuss the dishes and wine list with me! I do have plans for a Sunday brunch, but if my third experience isn't amazing I will be passing by Dunya for the remainder of my residency in Nob Hill.
author: Natalie M.

description: Amazing service and great Lamb dishes, the Beyti is a favorite of mine.  For breakfast try their Mediterranean Ranchero.
author: Shayne S.

description:
I was intrigued by this place when it opened up about a year or two ago, and it seemed mainly like a wine bar at first.  Didn't try it till this weekend, after walking by it many, many times.  

It is also a mediterranean restaurant, and we tried it for lunch this weekend.  I felt that the service and food were decent, though I feel that Aicha (Moroccan food down the street) is better food and a better value.  We had the dolma, which were small and expensive.  I had a wrap that was filled with beeef/lamb, but I thought that the meat portion was a bit skimpy as well.

But this place has a cozy atmosphere, isn't too expensive, and they have an extensive offering of wines.  I think we'd be back for the wine bar and maybe appetizers, but maybe not for another meal... not with so many great places to eat nearby.
author: Dave N.

description:
so one fine weekday evening, we drive from San Jose to SF and end up at this place. Don't know how and why...but at the end of it all, no regrets.

it's a small place and it was pretty late for a dinner (10.30pm) so relatively quiet as well. The server/bar-tender was attentive. Suggested some wines. Ended up getting a bottle for the table. I had the chicken shish kabab which was delicious. the falafal in the appetizers were pretty good as well. 

Loved the wine (Chardonnay), Love the Kababs...loved the ambience with a minimalistic design and open view of the kitchen. 

def. worth another visit to try out their other kababs.
author: S T.

description:
Downgrading this place for the eyesore of a chalkboard they have on the sidewalk.  Owners probably want some separation between their business and the crappy coffee place next door (which I can't blame them) but still, the chalkboard cheapens Dunya to the level of the Crepe House and detracts from the level of cuisine coming out of this otherwise fine establishment.

June 2011 - Further downgrading for piping music outdoors.  This is not a sustainable practice.  Just think if every shop piped their own music outside.  What a mess that would be.  Stop it Dunya!  You're slowing becoming a net negative for the neighborhood
author: David C.

description: Lamb was inedible, mostly fat and what wasn't was undercooked. I gave it my a few minutes in my mouth before I spit it out. Everything else was par.
author: Chris S.

description:
Me and my girlfriend gave a shot to dunya last night. The atmosphere here was warm,classy and inviting,we both love Mediterranean food,we tried in a couple other places but we did not satisfy enough. We really loved this spot. Excellent  food, with test full flavors , and warm professional service, reasonable prices,we loved Beyti. Great chef-owner operated bistro. We will definitely come back and try other dishes. Thank you chef Coskun!!

We highly recomanded
author: Robert T.

description:
Yelp needs to have a 1/2 star. I really want to give it 3 1/2 stars. 

They have a great wine selection, but I feel it is overpriced. I mean $9-$10 for a glass of wine? 

We has hummus as the app and that was quite tasty. The pita was fresh and warm which made it AMAZING!

I got adana kebab and it was good except I wasn't expecting it to be spicy. I like spiced, but never have i had it spicy. Since I don't like that I was not ecstatic. The rice and veggies that accompanied it were great though. Smaller portions ( I always like some leftovers to take home) but they were filling. 

The service was very attentive and the place is cute for a date. Overall not bad, but not spectacular
author: Whitney G.

description: I love the variety and satisfaction of the mezze/mixed platter from any Mediterranean/Middle Eastern establishment, so call it foolish, but it's kind of my go-to thing to order whenever trying out a new place.  Then, if I like it, I'll definitely go back and try something else they have to offer.  Can't say there was anything special about their mixed platter, though their lentil soup and pasha bayildi (stuffed eggplant with pine nuts, tomatoes, onion, and feta) were amazing.  Though not a vegetarian myself, I appreciate that their vegetarian dishes are not afterthoughts that they put on the menu just to say they have something vegetarian.
author: Jenn C.

description: I went here on a whim.  My friend and I shared the mezze platter and had a couple glasses of wine.  I thought everything was pretty great.  The service was phenomenal.  We were not rushed, they were friendly, and they treated us so well that we knew we would come back again.  The vibe they have created in this place is so cozy and comfortable.  It feels great.  The food was all wonderful.  We got little tastes of everything and we decided there wasn't any one thing that we would not want to have again.  We will come back when we are a little more hungry to try some other things.
author: Ashley W.

description: Fresh, authentic, home-made style Mediterranean cuisine, superb and diversified wine list with many 'per glass' choices, with a cozy and informal atmosphere. Friendly and attentive service.
author: Lisa B.

description: Nice place to go for a class of wine. It is chill.
author: Shelley M.

description:
Dunya is less than 6 months old; it has about 25 seats for dinner + a dozen bar seats. Location near the corner of Sacramento & Polk is great (also #19 bus almost in front of the door). Owner Ramon told us his wife makes ALL the desserts, and you must try the cheesecake --- yes it is fine, dense, quite a generous serving.

On two separate visits, we've had the lamb chop entree, the seafood risotto entree, the Mediterranean plate appetizer ($1 add'l for extra pita; regular price includes babaganoush, hummus, olives, yogurt, cucumbers), vegetarian stack entree, lamb meatballs (appetizer stuffed with olives & topped with feta), and the pita/hummus appetizer. Dunya's hummus is the best I've had & the pita arrives hot, hot.  Also interesting: the starter bread (with herbed oil) is heated to toast temperature, but not browned. If you expect warmed bread with your meal, this is a welcome bonus. 

Favorites: cheesecake, lamb chops, hummus, risotto. But everything shines. We didn't have the wine, but the blackboard list is amazing -- NZ, Aussie, Napa, Argentina, Santa Lucia, and those are just the wines by the glass (range $6 - $17 per). Wine flights look pretty creative, popular. 

5 stars? Yes, it's possible. We found the music a tad too loud, and our cushions kept falling off the benches. Prices could be lower for size of servings, and a lower price would also bring in more customers. We first found this with a Groupon.com ($15 for a $30 credit), and returned a few days later to try more menu items. It is also on opentable.com/ It's the kind of place I'd like to see remain at this location; however, they seem to be having trouble attracting customers. Maybe Groupon & Open Table will help draw more in on weekends.
author: joyce h.

description:
I just wanted to pick up a falafel wrap from here today. Dunya has really bonded with the coffee shop next door so it feels more comfortable to just walk into. I called to order the falafel to save time. I was told it would take 15-20 minutes. Poor girl, she'd just started and didn't know how long it takes to cook something. But I'd imagined they were just that busy -that a wrap could take so long. I have been struggling with a Mediterranean urge and haven't been able to satisfy it properly, so I decided to see how Dunya can do in this department. It was decently priced for 3 falafel, lettuce, special sauce, blah tomatoes, including garlic fries (yum) and bite of mixed-greens salad: $6.74. I had some struggle getting in and out with my lunch due to the sweet but chatty waitress. No one was there besides me, granted it was about 2PM, but it felt a bit desperate. 
Moral of story: the falafel wrap was as bland as could be. I guess a trip to Oasis in the financial district is still the only way.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I discovered this place 3 or 4 months ago, and what a great find that was! Dunya is by far my favorite Mediterranean restaurant now. Adana-Kebobs are best in the city. Staff is super friendly and attentive, atmosphere really cozy.
author: MihaSF N.

description: Came here for a birthday dinner. I was surprised I had never noticed it because I've walked by tons of times but I'm glad now i know! Super cute place , great atmosphere, great service, and good food.  We had just gone to Troya the night before and I have to admit that the appetizers were not as good at Dunya-maybe the falafels and hummus at Troya were just extra good but for some reason, they just werent as good here.  Nevertheless, the menu had some great options for a picky eater like me and a vegan plate that was sooo good and filling-they were also very accommodating with any substitutions or special requests.  The desserts were awesome and the waiters were really friendly and even went the extra mile to bring our friend out some cake and turn down the lights so we could all sing happy birthday.  Will definitely be coming back!
author: Renee S.

description:
This is my first Yelp review.  I was inspired to write because I could not stand idly by and see this place have a yelp rating on par w/ Acquerello and some of the really terrific restaurants in the area.

I was excited to go here after read all the 4 and 5 star reviews of this place - heck it's a Mediterranean wine bar, basically on my block!  Not to mention my gf had a Bloomspot coupon for $30 of food.  What could go wrong?  Unfortunately, this place fizzled out like the French soccer team at the World Cup.

I hope they were simply having an off night, because it was one of the worst meals I've had.  I started with a beet salad, which was OK, nothing to write home about.  But then I got... the vegetable risotto.  It was basically unseasoned.  Ok, I lie.  It was seasoned.  With more garlic in a plate than I had ever seen before.  The risotto was overpowered by garlic, garlic, and more garlic.  And the dish basically had no salt.  There was not one thing redeeming about this dish.  My girlfriend ordered the duck special, and it was good enough.  Nothing memorable.

Service was also...strange.  Our waitress, unfortunately, had some sort of arm injury and served us one-handed.  That was admirable, but not ideal from my perspective.  This was a Friday night around 6:30, and were were the ONLY group in the restaurant.  So you'd think, ok, this is a weird vibe, but food will be fast, right?  WRONG.  The waitress came to our table twice to tell us our food was coming and she was sorry for the delay.  If you have to apologize for the delay...it is probably an excessive delay.  Which made absolutely no sense because we were the only people there.  I could see the chef standing in the kitchen...he didn't LOOK busy, but what do I know?  Finally, each time we got a course, the waitress came by w/in 30 seconds of our first bite to ask us how the food is.  Of course we hadn't had time to TASTE it yet.

So you say - it wasn't your best meal, but it shouldn't have been pricey, not with your $30 Bloomspot coupon, right?  I thought I'd be getting a good deal when I told my gf to order what she wanted, and I'd cover whatever her coupon did not.  Well, we each got $10 wine flights, and our own appetizer plus the entree.  The total was close to $50 on TOP of the coupon.  We could not wait to get out, what a bizarre dining experience.  I felt so awkward about only eating only 2 bites of my entree that I asked for a box, said I was full.  I'm sure she knew THAT was not true.

I really hope that other people had better experiences, but I want to make sure other people don't go to this place expecting a 4.5 star experience, and end up with what I got.
author: Ravi R.

description: Agree w/ Mish. Go for the mixed platter - appetizer as well as entree. Service is excellent. The wait staff reminds me of Jason Statham movies.
author: Johnson H.

description:
Went here twice and really, really, really wanted to like this place.  $12 bottomless  mimosas? Yes! Ridiculously close to mi casa? Si, senor!  Cute interior? You betcha!  Amazing-sounding menu posted online? Fuck yeah!

The first time we ordered off the brunch menu.  We got pancakes to share, kobe beef hash for me, kobe sliders for the hubs.  

The beef hash was pretty good: not too greasy, but still flavorful.  The eggs were perfectly done (though, how hard is it not to fuck up eggs?) and the potatoes were yummy.  The meat was ground beef and didn't taste kobe-tender, but I assumed that was just because it was ground.  (I would later find out that this restaurant just uses bad meat)

I didn't try the sliders, but the hubs seemed to enjoy them.  Well, the outside of them, anyway: he ordered them medium-well, but they were definitely rare.  We were kind of in a rush (and he was pretty happy from the mimosas), so we didn't complain.

The pancakes were pretty tasty, but also undercooked.  They aren't like typical American pancakes and are closer in taste to European pancakes (sweeter, creamier, more crispiness on the outside).  If they were fully done, they would've been amazing.

The second time we went (lunch) was just horrendous.  To start, the menu options that are posted online for lunch were listed on the in-resto menu at much higher prices (e.g. pomegranite kobe steak is $10 online, $17 in person).  My bro and I both got the kobe steak kebabs and I must call shenanigans, because this was NOT kobe steak.  I've had better quality meat at crappy taco trucks in the East Bay.  Scratch that, I've had better quality meat at crappy taco trucks in Tijuana.  

The steak was inedible.  Literally.   I spent the whole time chewing around chunks of fat and connective tissue.  I'm not a picky eater (especially when it comes to steak) and I have a good bite, but I couldn't handle the kebabs. Unfortunately, we were in a rush again and didn't send the food back.  We should've.

Dunya is really cute inside and is a nice addition to the below-Clay stretch of Polk.  I just wish that the quality of the food matched the look.  *Sigh*
author: Alisa N.

description:
I had a Bloomspot coupon that was about to expire so we made a reservation for 3 at 7 pm on Friday night. It took longer than we thought for my friend & I to get out of the office, so my boyrfriend called to change the reservation to 7:45 pm. We arrived just on time, but apparently our reservation hadn't been changed "on the books". The place is pretty small, so we stood at the bar and nearly finished off a bottle of Cotes du Rhone Rose before we were seated about a half-hour later. Since the coupon was for a certain dollar amount off of wine purchases, we decided to go with another bottle once we got seated. We then shared a few of the vegetarian apps to start: Kabak Ezme, Crispy Falafels, and Sigara Boregi; a plate of pita triangles came on the side.
The Kabak Ezme was a kind of pureed zucchini-yogurt dip, flavored with mint, dill, and garlic. The dip was thick like Labneh, with a great yogurt tang and a subtle hint of garlic. The falafels were nicely crispy and just the right size - I am so tired of baseball-sized falafels. The accompanying tahini was very creamy and flavorful. The Sigara Boregi were just what they sound like - little "cigars" of feta and parsley wrapped in phyllo and then fried. These were actually my least favorite of the apps, just seemed a little bland compared to the others. There didn't seem to be much parsley *or* feta flavor. I even dipped them in first the tahini then the Kabak, but that didn't add any flavor either. They might have needed a little longer in the fryer as well, the phyllo wasn't that crisp. 
For our main courses, we opted for the prawn shish kebab and the beyti. The shish kebab was served as 2 skewers and was definitely enough for 2 people to share. It was a nice presentation of prawns threaded with lemon slices. The prawns were well-cooked and lemony and apparently marinated in "exotic spices". The beyti was a dish not familiar to me, but it was delicious. Thin lavash bread was wrapped around oblong patties of finely ground beef and lamb. The meat was well-seasoned and spiced. A rather uninteresting tomato sauce surrounded the individual "wraps", while some more tangy yogurt and some unremarkable veggies came on the side. We had filled up so much on the apps that we had to take some beyti home with us and didn't have room for dessert. The beyti tasted very good for breakfast yesterday :-)
Minus a star for not having the Turkish national dish of Manti (!) and another for the seating issue at the beginning. I wish a couple dishes were more cohesive as well. There is another coupon today through SF Weekly though, so I will probably buy that and return to try the lamb burger and the piyaz based on their yum reviews.
author: Stephanie S.

description: Great food and our server was the manager I think, he gave us some amazing wine recommendations.  They have a wine flight for $10 during Happy Hour, you can mix and match and you get a generous portion of each wine.  The Feta Shrimp was amazing!  Will definitely go back.
author: Ginger C.

description: Dunya has great food and a great vibe.  There are many regulars at Dunya and everyone is treated great by the staff. The Mediterranean ranchero eggs at brunch time is really amazing. They make great kababs as well.
author: Seth E.

description:
Didn't like our entrees, at all.  My boyfriend and I are not foodies by any means, and are happy with most any food, we love to eat!  We ordered the seafood risotto and the waiter recommended a chef special - a salmon with a white wine sauce.  The risotto lacked flavor and the veggies, red onions, green & red peppers, were pretty much raw and crunchy, they just didn't seem to go.  The scallops and shrimp were like what you get from the freezer aisle at Costco, not bad, but not great either.  It seemed like an entree by someone just learning how to cook.  The salmon also lacked flavor and we probably would've been better off going with the orange BBQ salmon that was on the menu.  Both dishes were blah and I didn't finish my risotto.  The food also seemed overpriced for what you get, even if it was delicious food.

It was empty on a Saturday night at 8:30 p.m. so that should've been our indication.

Service was fine, but will not be returning.
author: K V.

description: I lucked into a rock star parking space and had almost an hour to kill before meeting a friend for dinner. After being glared at by other folks hoping to snag my prime piece of parking real estate, I headed over to the shops on Polk Street. I wandered in to Dunya to get out of the rain, after deciding a glass of wine was better than a cup of coffee.  The bartender was really friendly and before I knew it I was ordering a cup of soup to "warm up". I was planning on a nice spot of Lentil, but the bartender recommended the daily special, salmon chowder, because it would go really well with my glass of Laurier Pinot. In fact it did. The soup was hot and nourishing with a nice balance of seasoning. It hit the spot, as did the warm pita that accompanied it. I like Dunya, especially since my visit there was unplanned and because they let me dawdle over my glass of wine until my hour was almost up. I want to go back sometime and try more things.
author: Nicole M.

description: Defiantly one of my favorite spots in the city to hit up! Their bottomless mimosa on Saturday and Sunday is awesome, also their food is very delicious.
author: Ryan M.

description: Came here for a birthday brunch for one of my friends.  I didn't love the entree I ordered (prosciutto omelet) but we were there pretty much for bottomless mimosas!  A pretty good deal for brunch.  Dunya is fairly small and cozy, and I'll come back to give it another shot for dinner.
author: Helen T.

description: Love this place! Great food and amazing service. Adana is my favorite dish! Be sure to try the hummus as well.
author: Tyler S.

description: This place is whack.  Service was horrible, but I understand cause boss man was the only guy there plus a bus boy.  Still it does not take 10 mins to give me a drank and I had to ask for a napkin/utensil combo after I was done with my appetizer.  I ordered the hummus and baba ganoush plate.  If you're a mediterranean restaurant and cannot make good hummus, you should kill yourself.  The rack of lamb was small like they bought it off a discount skinny lamb.  Still I tipped phat cause I understand being busy when waiters bail, doesn't mean you get a good review though.
author: Richard N.

description: And now I've had the weekend brunch which is absolutely delicious. So on heels of my previous post, great food, great service -- you really can't go wrong here.
author: Shauna S.

description: A nice local place,and  very easy to be vegan! Good wine selection and friendly staff. We usually go early and sit at the bar ... very relaxing.
author: Eric W.

description: Had an amazing meal here last night.  Started off with lamb meatballs and yellow squash soup, then had a perfectly cooked filet.  Great wine and beer list, wonderful ambiance, very friendly staff, and a nice flat screen so we can come back next time and watch a game while enjoying our meal.  Will definitely be back again.
author: Stephanie R.

description: Some of the best falafel I have ever had. The service was a bit slow, though. Great ambiance and a lovely interior. We will definitely go back!
author: John X.

description: Just moved into the area. Just started culinary school at CCA so ive been trying to eat out as much as I can afford! A fellow student and I decided to take a gander around polk street to see what we where in the mood for to eat for dinner and we came across Duny. It seemed to be some what busy the menu looked pretty reasonable. So we decided to eat there for dinner. The service was okay the busser did a wonderful job our acually waiter in my opinion was rude. But whatever I was here for the food I had a farfelle salad with avocado salsa and goat chesse it was phenomenal. My girlfriend that came with me had a lamb burger and it was cooked perfectly with a hit of mint. it was very good, it would of got a 5 star if the server wasnt rude! Service is a big part of my dinning experience.
author: Alana G.

description: I live a block from Dunya, and it's my go-to on Polk (I think I know everyone by name).  I've met more people in Dunya that have become good friends than any other place in SF.  Food coming out of the open kitchen is consistently delicious, the atmosphere is warm, and Toni and Sertac behind the bar are awesome.  Brunch on weekends is very solid and affordable, and if you're into the unlimited mimosa thing, this is your place.  Definitely more of a restaurant/lounge and a great first date spot, but certainly not the dim, snooty wine bar prototype that is disappointingly prevalent (they have a TV in the rear to catch games, etc.)
author: Alex W.

description: Really good. Best Mediterranean I've had in the city. Good wine and reasonably priced. Definitely recommend stopping in. Great service and great ambiance.
author: Alexandra B.

description:
this is a great neighborhood restaurant. 

go here and get the half chicken! the sauce is lemony and very good.  and it is filling.

the people that work here are very friendly too!
author: Tawny C.

description: Delicious! I came here w/ my team and loved everything I tried. Food was perfectly prepared, tasty and good sized. Dessert was excellent as well. I'll be coming back!
author: Stephanie Y.

description: I really wanted to like this place - my favorite style of food 3 blocks from home. I went for lunch (the place was empty - bad sign) - ordered a veggie panini and 'Turkish Coffee' - neither had any resemblance whatsoever to what I was expecting. The veggie panini was a kind of grilled hero and the coffee was a brewed cup of the same kind of over-roasted slop so common around here.
author: George S.

description: We love this place for its wonderful food and outstanding service. The general ambiance rocks too. The waiters are very attentive and fun, and some of them super cute.
author: leigh b.

description:
Excellent service; friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable .  Wonderful food:  today's Special/Cajun Pasta with salmon and oysters-delicious! richly sauced seafood on fresh fettuccine,  Herb Roasted free-range crispy-skinned chicken in Pomegranate BBQ sauce with roasted organic Yukon Gold potatoes and seasonal vegetables/zucchini, carrots, squash delighted with amazing flavor.  Ample portions.  Happy Hour 4 to 7 pm Appetizer + glass of wine $10 - Don't miss the Lamb meatballs stuffed with olives - 
We had no room for desserts tonight and will return another evening for the lemon tart and tiramisu.
author: Geri S.

description: AMAZING food at exceptional prices. Great service, really reasonable wine list, cozy atmosphere. The mixed appetizer platter can be a meal - it's my favorite thing on the menu. The adana kebab and kofte kebab are also delicious. I am so glad this place changed their menu!!!! It's the perfect addition to the neighborhood.
author: Kristin B.

description: Dunya rocks, especially for brunch. I am partly biased since I know the owner as well as his #1 server. But truly, the brunch here is amazing (omelettes with hummus) and the mimosas are generous pours. It gets great fresh air and a nice spot for group brunches.
author: Susan A.

description: the food was so good, definitely recommend the beyti.
author: Glynis M.

description: Stumbled along this delightful gem while strolling through Nob Hill on a recent visit for a conference.  How lucky we were!  The service was top-notch, the restaurant was very clean, and the food was delicious!  My wife ordered and raved about the stuffed falafel sald, and I had the beyti.  Both were bursting with flavor, masterfully cooked and beautifully plated.  This was by far our favorite restaurant during our trip.
author: Chris M.

description: the food was good and the happy hour deal was awesome. $10 wine flight including 3 glasses of wine. sweet!
author: V L.

description: flavor explosion in your mouth!! my boyfriend had the falafel and said it was fresh, I had the prosciutto sandwich and it was bomb. yum.
author: b b.

description: My husband and I tried this place because we had a groupon there. The service was lackluster and the food was not good. Sadly we have not discovered a new favorite and will not be returning.
author: Katie R.

description:
A group of 4 of us visited Dunya for the first time last Friday and had an overall great experience. I had probably passed by Dunya dozens of times walking up and down Polk St., but it never really caught my eye until I was perusing Yelp. As we were already in the mood for Mediterranean, this was the perfect spot...a good mix of eclectic vibe, young (20-30 something) crowd and extensive menu (a little something for everyone...veggie, meats, etc.)

I made a same day reservation on a Friday, and I'm glad I did. There were a few large parties and a few 2-tops, and the place was packed. We were immediately sat and the "cozy" atmosphere made for a server/busser to always be available for an order or other need.

Apps:
Mixed Platter - Perfect for 4-6 people, great assortment of foods
Falafel Salad - I can never have enough falafel, so even though these came on the Mixed Platter, I still craved more. The avocado salsa was subtle, much lighter, zestier than a guacamole.
Feta Prawns - OMG. The four of us (2 guys/2 girls) couldn't stop sopping up the broth of this dish. Seriously, pita, falafel, spoons--it was so darn good (4 prawns).

Entrees 
Pasha bayildi - Scrumptious stuffed eggplant dish. Seemed kind of Italian meets Greek to me due to the red sauce. Still, delicious stuffing. Great portion for a vego
Mixed Grill - Yum. A generous mix of chicken, lamb & beef. Can't go wrong.

We shared everything and walked out just like Greek people...fat and happy. We also ordered beer, sparkling and red wine all by the glass. I was impressed by their selection and diversity of their by-the-glass list. Service was fast and efficient, not overly friendly, but not rude either. Just like I like it, there when you need 'em. Well-priced for the ambiance, food and service. Would go back!
author: Tanya B.

description: review is for the wine bar only and not the food. i met the owner here and he seems like a nice man. but charging $6.57 for a pint of beer is just wrong. i'm not even at the ballpark.
author: Pickle R.

description: Awesome little neighborhood spot. Great service, delicious food, good wine. They deserve the praise!
author: Karl P.

description: LOVE this place! I started going to Dunya back in 2011 and was really impressed with the quality of the food and wine. They have a great selection of different mediterranean plates. Prices were good and portion sizes were great, plenty room for leftovers :) I really enjoyed the ambiance of the entire restaurant, cozy and friendly. Great date place or a nice night out with some friends. I HIGHLY recommend trying their dessert menu. My favorite is their Kunafa, delicious!
author: Claudia F.

description: Nice service -  Had a couple appetizers just OK
author: Michael P.

description:
Delicious food!  The lamb meatballs and Mediterranean sample platter are a must. The ambiance is great, as well as the wine list.  Will definitely be making this a go-to spot.

Also, do not skip the baklava!
author: Kendra C.

description: Come a little later at night for some personal and personable service from Rimon behind the bar. Rimon fosters a sense of community at Dunya. The food and wine are good, and I truly miss coming to Dunya multiple times a week for a nightcap now that I'm on the east-coast. Rimon is the man.
author: Kevin O.

description: Great environment and food. Ramon is a great and super friendly host!Good wine selection too.
author: Mariana P.

description:
our server was not too friendly although he tried to be but his face expression looks so mad.  We were there for brunch, so I guess he was not having a good day that day.
The food wasn't good, their dessert, terramishu tasted like Costco/Trader Joe ones.
author: Elle Z.

description: This is clearly a family owned establishment. We stumbled upon it while walking down Polk St, and thought the menu looked good. Unbeknownst to us, the family was celebrating a graduation that took up almost the entire dining room. Still, we walked into the bar, and they welcomed us into the party with open arms. The food and service was fantastic (try the calamari!). Great wine selection, and great atmosphere!
author: Samantha B.

description: A nice cozy atmosphere made a great setting for a night out with my wife.  However, I just can't give them more than two stars.  The tuna was fishy, the lamb was gamey, the hummus was dry and the wine was thin.  The service was super friendly though.
author: Andy G.

description:
Went the other nite with some friends for drinks 
And a bite to eat. That was a big mistake because this 
Place is a circus. The food was lousy & atmosphere was 
Tired.
author: Jane f.

description: We love going to Dunya.  The wine is very good and the pours are generous.  The food, especially the appys are very tasty.  The staff are very nice.  We will miss Tony because he is moving.  Dunya is not expensive so we can go often.
author: Ken S.

description:
Dropped in here with a couple of friends on a Sunday evening...the place was pretty empty, which after my experience, surprised me.  We pulled up three seats to the bar and our intention was just to have an appetizer and a glass of wine before continuing our evening  elsewhere.  

We ended up staying for a few hours and had a few different dishes to share and plenty of wine.  This is a newer business and they still seem to be experimenting with the menu and specials offered for happy hours, etc.  The owners were very kind and attentive and everything we tried was delicious.  The presentation of each plate was also really nice.

I live in the neighborhood and hadn't noticed the establishment in the past few months, maybe for signage reasons?  Now that I have discovered it, I will definitely be going back and recommend it to others.
author: J C.

description:
This place is amazing!!! I was very skeptical at first because it's a new place and there aren't very many reviews. I took a big risk because it was for my husbands birthday and I was so very pleasantly surprised.  

When my husband went to the restroom, I told the waitress it was his birthday and she asked what kind of dessert I would like, so the chef made a cobbler just for us!  He also made us beet salads on the house (yay), which had just the right amount of beets mixed with mango.  

We started with the stuffed green olives with lamb and they were sublime.  The way the dish is prepared is four lamb meatballs with olives in the middle...so they are lamb meatballs stuffed with olives.  We also had a prawn salad that was so rich and creamy and the prawns were warm, which was a really nice mix of warm and cool and different textures.  We had the lamb riblets that came with a great sauce.  We had Kobe Sirloin which was prepared just right with organic veggies and potatos.

My husband ordered a beer and I had a glass of wine.  The best part was the bill!!! $54
author: Edith S.

description: They have amazing happy hour specials even on the weekend. I believe if you ordered two wines, you would get an appetizer which was quite nice. I look forward to going back and catching dinner.
author: Kalifornia S.

description: Really cool staff, great selection of wines, cool open kitchen with smiling chef, a great place to take someone for quiet time.
author: A E.

description: Had lunch with a friend yesterday and it was an exquisite experience.  The food was fresh, delicious.  The menu for lunch was very reasonably priced.  Can't wait to go back for dinner.  THis is a fabulous place to eat and I hope people give it a try.  You won't be disappointed.  I had the ground chicken sandwich and a luscious salad with shrimp, fingerling potatoes, avocado, mango and a wonderful dressing.  The atmosphere is quiet, and laid back.  Service was excellent. All  around a very positive experience.
author: Leslie P.

description: Great place.... I mean by that , food , wine price, atmosphere and all the team work. Been there twice already for lunch and I can't wait to go for the third time. I will not recommend anything, because everything is just delicious ..... Give it a shot , u will not be disappointed.
author: Munzer B.

description: We went to this place using a groupon. We ordered the crispy ahi tuna tartar and the tuna looked like it came out of a can. It was not fresh. For my entree, I ordered the vegetarian vine ripe tomato risotto. It looked and tasted like rice w/ tomato sauce. I couldn't even tell what vegetables were in there b/c they were all covered in tomato sauce. I think it might have been potato. There was no mozzerella and definitely no avocado. I went with a group of 8 total and the only person who liked her dish ordered the chicken. The only nice part was the waiter. I definitely will not be going back.
author: E G.

description: Service was good as far as refilling water goes. Food was OK but I've had better at La Mediterranea.  Also I thought it was a bit overpriced.  If you want real Mediterranean I would go elsewhere. Also you had to shout for a conversation. Place echoes and is very loud on top of the background music (oh right you can hardly hear it). Prob not the best place for a romantic date.  If you do end up trying it out, the mixed platter is more than enough for 2 people.  It did take a while (over 30 min) to bring the first course of food out.  Not a good place to go if you're in a rush or starving for food on a Saturday night.
author: Eesayah O.

description: Let me start off by saying that I usually love this place and would give it 4 stars. However, my experience at brunch yesterday was terrible. My friend and I came by for brunch around 10:30am. There was one bartender, one server and one busser on staff which is definitely where the problem began. We were seated by the busser (who was awesome, and shouldn't be blamed in any way for poor service), and had to wait a full 20 minutes before even being greeted by the server. I ordered a coffee and then proceeded to wait another 20 minutes for the cream I requested, which was useless by the time it arrived as the coffee was cold. The server who was absolutely spacey, took our orders without writing anything down which was also a red flag. When our food arrived, my order was completely wrong. The server repeatedly tried to shove an omelet in front of me while glaring at me as if I were incompetent. After I refused the food for the third time he finally decided to give me what I ordered (which took another 20 minutes). My friend was forced to wait for his food as well while mine was being re-prepared, but the server brought out his original plate of food which was freezing and congealed. The server then offered a rather muted apology and that was it. We were also not offered refills of coffee or water until we had paid the check. What was really devastating was that the table right next to us had the exact same thing happen but their messed up food was "bought" by the horrendous server. Seriously!? Why would I not get the same service? I haven't been this disappointed in a restaurant in a long time but in this case it was all the servers fault as the food was still good. I would strongly suggest adding a person to your brunch service or getting rid of this useless one as he singlehandedly ruined a beautiful Sunday morning.
author: Kimara M.

description: Delicious food (I think it's Turkish?), warm comfortable ambiance (except for the sports channel on the flat screen behind the bar... what's up with that?  And super friendly.  My friend and I had a late dinner there on a Thursday night, and after we finished eating, we lingered for a long time... until we were the only ones in the place.  The waiters had all gone home, the cooks were cleaning the kitchen, and two guys who I assume own the place were just hanging out at the bar having a glass of wine. I started to worry we were overstaying our welcome, but supposedly the place is open til 1 am... and it was now 11:30 pm.  Just as I was starting to worry, one of the owners came up with a 2/3 empty bottle of wine and asked me if I'd help him finish it off. I asked if they were trying to close... he said, "No, take your time... for another half hour." I'll definitely be coming back to this place. Oh btw, yes, the lamb meatballs are crazy good.
author: Michael C.

description: Great service, great place to be a local regular -they get to know their guests!
author: A M.

description: We stumbled upon this place when we were waiting in-line for brunch at Toast and wait was about an hour.  Dunya was next door with no wait.   Since time was short, we decided to give them a try.  We sat ourselves since the waiter was running around "looking busy" - as only few tables were occupied.   We finally caught his attention and placed our order.  A few more people came in and the place eventually filled up.  However, half an hour later, all the new comers got their food (there were bunch of mistakes with their orders) and we still staring at an empty table.   I started running out of patience and tried to get our waiter's attention. He told us that the kitchen was working on our order (I doubted that, but thought it was a good reminder to him to finally place it). Another 15 min passed by...  I asked waiter about our order again and his response was "Yes, there is a wait - we are not a McDonalds..." Seriously?! We were finally fed up with the lack of service and his extreme rudeness and walked out the door.  We went back to Toast and were sat and served immediately (the hour-long wait list just caught up with us).  I realize now why there was no line to Dunya at all - the staff and the kitchen have no idea what they are doing! Not sure if their food is any good, but Dunya should not be in the restaurant business if they can't serve it timely and provide polite service.
author: Jeanette E.

description: Great lamb meatballs for appetizer and awesome risotto with stellar sea food. (They don't really go together and I didn't order both but sneaked a bit of the appetizer from my companion's plate). Can't vouch for anything else, but what I had was good!
author: Yana M.

description: Love this little spot- total hole in the wall but def a must go if you enjoy middle eastern/mediterranean foods! We stopped by after catching a movie and ordered 2 glasses of wine and a plate of falafel. The falafel is a must- excellent presentation, super fresh and delicious (did not have that baking soda taste as some places do). The wine was smooth and the atmosphere very relaxed and made you feel like you were in a bar in Madrid/Istanbul. The bartender was super friendly (maybe the owner) and just very nice! :) We can't wait to come back ! Bottomline:if you need a casual spot thats very unique, fun delicious  reasonably priced and chill come here for sure!! :)
author: sue c.

description: Go with the app sampler.  Great place.
author: William H.

description: I loved it. Great people and great food. Not much else to add. I had brunch there. I read some of the complaints... come on guys, its just food and people who work at restaurants have lives too, na mean?
author: Zain A.

description: Love this place! Best wine bar in the city! Rimon, the owner, is exceptionally friendly and very generous with the pours! Almost never too crowded, and way friendlier than Amelie. Live in the neighborhood, and this is now my neighborhood haunt.
author: Erik H.

description: Love the lamb kebabs! Cute , cozy place to have good conversation with friends, have a glass of wine and enjoy great food. Staff was really courteous and made sure everything perfectly prepared. Nice view of the kitchen and Chef preparing sumptuous meals.
author: Lady j.

description: This place was really cute. Good mashed potatoes and tiramisu. The service was great. I'm gonna go back and check out the happy hour ;)
author: Diane F.

description: Visited Dunya last evening with a few friends.  The service was quick and attentive.  We had the Salmon, Chicken, and a vegetarian dish.  Great food.  We all shared, thus, I can vouch for all main dishes.  The cheesecake was just right.  Will return on my next trip to San Francisco.
author: A A.

description:
went for dinner last night. service was very good, food was good too.

the happy hour deal for a glass of wine with an appetizer is a great deal. we had the shrimp salad and the smoke salmon with grits pancake and both were very tasty.
author: leslie y.

description: took my groupon there to eat.  i got the crispy ahi tuna tartare and for the entree i had seabass (not on menu, was a special that day).  the food was amazing.  the wine was terrific as well.  their little olive dish in which you dip the bread was fantastic (i want the recipe).  i'd come back here again definitely, except for the fact that i have about 8 other groupons waiting to be used.
author: I. M.

description: great selection of wines! the bartender/waiter was knowledgeable (and very handsome) and the owner was hanging around -- really personable. very attentive service. my friend and I both had chicken soup, and I had the kobe steak, which was melt in your mouth delicious! loved the sauce and the grilled veggies that came with it. my friend had the pork chops, which she liked very much, as well. for dessert, we had the chocolate brownie, which was good, but would have been much better with ice cream or even whipped cream -- alas! I will definitely head back again.
author: rachel s.
